BvueVqOB6YCPyBqh0LyGlw.text: Great pizza. I like my food hot... This pizza was exactly that. There was a hair on my crust, Ew. I don't eat the crust anyways so it didn't bother me that much LOL. Only reason I'm giving it 4 stars. Other than that the pizza was great. Not too much pizza sauce and just the right amount of cheese. Pepperoni was crispy just how I like it. Andddddd maybe the women should wear hair nets. Just a suggestion.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple pepperoni pizza.

BkyMNSab9BTvoQ_W0i8qzg.text: Their slices are like arm length, i kid you not!  I got the white spinach chicken pizza and hubby got the pepperoni. We got the combo so it came with a garlic knot and a drink. Not a bad deal for lunch especially on the strip.  I liked my white pizza better than the pepperoni. Something about the sauce on the pepperoni I wasn't feeling, but over all good pizza. You will definitely be full! they are located right next to PINK'S. There is limited seating, but you really dont need to sit down. Just eat your pizza standing up and watch all the people look and drool at you while they walk by.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9xtPP8hvGwriSZ-nKAl5TQ.text: The hubby and I was roaming around vegas blvd and decided to go back to our hotel.  We were staying at Planet Hollywood. We were suppose to go to secret pizza but the group decided to end things early. After thinking of pizza for almost the whole day, I saw pin up pizza and dedcided to check it out.   The line was super short on a friday night. I believe I only had to wait three person to order. I ended up getting the Sausage pizza. Yummy. The thin crust pizza is the best and they reheat up the pizza, so you're getting a nice hot out of the oven pizza. The pizza was indeed a huge slice. My hubby didn't get one cause he knew I wouldn't finish it. In my mind, I was thinking i'll show him, but really I ate like five bites and still it was so much pizza left. He was very happy to finish the rest for me.   For the price and sizes of the pizza it was an excellent deal. I would come back and try their chicken and spinach pizza. I was so eyeing that pizza.

RQCA_e7yM3wA-r5qnFJCuw.text: I feel betrayed and cannot trust yelp anymore. There was nothing to write home about this joint. Went there around 2 am. Seemed busy. But the pizzas was disappointing. There was barely sauce or meat on it. Lacked of flavors. They looked sad on the countertop. Overall, a overrated joint. I'm guessing those 5 star reviews are from drunk people or people who eat mac n cheese with ranch.

l2kt6P64vus9PwCjdJJnpQ.text: A nice quick place to get a snack, especially at the odd hours. The only lament is it's already cooked but then reheated. But they are big good slices.

AJSsebi-SQksLPmAujQjRg.text: It's a good spot for the late night meals but be warned you may not get the warmest greeting. They also don't have to go boxes if you are trying to take your pizza back to your room. The cashier was also rude so keep what you ask for at a minimum or she will start rolling her eyes. The pizza wasn't even that good so it was a waste if time the only thing i give this place is how big the slices were. Will not be returning.

X8muNXvxFOItXyJUBjlTmg.text: Came here after a late night. I was craving pizza but didn't know where to go until a Planet Hollywood casino employee directed me to this fine little jewel.       Open late till 2 a.m. M-Th & till 4 a.m. Fri & Sat this is the perfect munchie spot for a late night craving. They have very limited seating inside and outside so make sure and have a buddy reserve a seat for you while you wait in line.       The pizza slices here are ginormous! I'm glad I only ordered one slice because I had no idea they were that large. The pizza was good but it was a little too thin and a little too greasy for me. It did satisfy my pizza craving though.       Next time I'm in Vegas and have the late night munchies, I know exactly where I'm headed.

hdfNDb2CDc_8w0w5Do7phA.text: The pizza is pretty good for a standard slice and fulfilling HOWEVER the customer service is lacking. The lady taking our order of a family of 4 was rude and unwelcoming. Didn't allow us time to figure out what slices we want since it was our first time there also because there are no name labels for which pizza has which toppings. She also did not finish taking our order and moved onto multiple guests after we had reminded her we were not done she told us to wait. Luckily the pizza wasn't as bad as her attitude. Seemed like even asking was an issue. She kept asking if we were done after every slice we would mention including the first considering there are more than one of us ordering food. Wouldn't reccomend or go back.

dpWGrZI5nI-tCATqGnzciQ.text: The must try is the pizza, knot and soda deal with tax it's about 10 bucks but it is worth the money!! The knot is perfectly seasoned and baked to perfection! The pizza is huge and 2 people could eat off this one slice. The staff are dressed so classy and put you in the mind of the pin up models hence the name. You select your pizza from the ones on display and they put them in their huge stove so you can actually see what your going to get before you order. We got the pepparoni, salami, peppercheni one it was amaizing! It does not take too long to get your food, my only complaint is there is really no room to eat your pizza there we had to go next door to the pinks hotdog place to sit and eat. The one thing i enjoy about some of the places on the strip is you can people watch as you eat your food, there are some interesting people who walk the strip...lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza so good forgot to take a before pic
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So big u have to fold it to eat it

7Jwin1JJwZLj3TGVAjs6Eg.text: U have to eat it right away cause if you dont its the hardest pizza you will ever eat lol its a okay pizza to some it up, Put it this way if your from new york and like to fold your pizza with little to no sauce you will enjoy it,  If your from chicago like myself then you will hate this pizza because its bland and flavorless  This is not a good pizza and to think i bought a slice of each one

HGi9NKLXXRGRGxKLjhTpbQ.text: Certainly THE BEST PIZZA IVE EVER TASTED!  The consistency of the bread and the toppings are just crazy good. They have an option to put some cherry tomatoes and some greens @ a black sauce...it's just delightful!  can't wait to try it again   *The cashier didn't have the best service, but I understand...it was 12am, and she was probably tired. *

d_3yFNnq7lybzc_3fn3HxQ.text: Awesome pizza. Jersey rated!!! Big slices, open late, friendly staff and did I mention giant slices!!!! I got pepperoni and chicken spinach white pizza, which as excellent. This place will be my new late night staple when in Vegas.

PjiBWPVUD3t7ZFv3pwCSQQ.text: Fantastic pizza and great combo deals, head into the casino with your pizza and bet on some sports, True Mancave style

PfQ-9ifmbWeFhLsYHKXa4Q.text: CHEAP. LARGE. SLICE.  There isn't really anything more to say.  Sober, the pepperoni slice was delicious. Drunk the pepperoni slice was delicious.    OVERALL:  I actually prefer this for late night pizza over secret pizza. Less hassle, good prices, and good slices!  Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

McZByPoAKFVPfxa9PghnuA.text: This place was so convenient while hanging out at Planet Hollywood.   $6 bucks for a huge slice of tasty pizza was just what I needed to put something in my belly.   It was fresh out of the oven, cooked perfect and very flavorful. Service with a smile  I'm a fan

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7zY1VVRcRnHZAjkwlTxhkQ.text: Pizza is ok, nothing special and service is ok. Great location and easy to get to as right in planet Hollywood.  Disappointed as tried the pizza in Laughlin and it was much better and not loaded with garlic in the sauce.  Not sure how you can run out of boxes for the pizza especially when people are ordering 4 and 5 pieces of pizza and have to carry them out on paper plates back to the hotel.

LQH9n4t_1BcFql-KRW16Og.text: Good pizza. Located inside Planet Hollywood but the outside strip has access of it too. This place is bad a$$! First, this sexy big breasted lady with dark brown hair is wearing a corset and heavy makeup to serve pizza. Then, if your order is to go, she has to assemble the triangular box quickly. The humongous slice of pizza gets heated up in the oven and it was so good. Each slice was worth roughly $6-7. But the slice equals 3 pizza hut slices. Not only is it a generous portion, it taste really good. The bread of the pizza has a crisp. Cook to perfection! It is also bad a$$ to see the cook put in the whole pizza in the oven. Amazing and worth coming!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni pizza- the kids complained that the pepperoni has a kick to it.
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and spinach- my fave!

lhtTAcFFWO7POa3Q1oII0w.text: The best pizza in Vegas!!! The slices are huge. It taste even better when you are tispy..lol

vUsddvikY6V8FQqS8ulEDQ.text: The best pizza this Sicilian has had - ever. We loved it so much we've been here 3 times in the last 36 hours. I joined Yelp just to review this place, honestly.   What we got: margarita, spinach & artichoke, sausage   Only down sides: 1) No place to sit in or out, 2) Pepsi products.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach &amp; artichoke + sausage combos

T7bPF-YxwWe9SAH8w27NVQ.text: Idk if my expectations were too high, but the pizza was basic thin style new york. Pizza options pre made-no alterations allowed. $75.00 for the whole pie (it is enormously big) $10.25 for one slice, garlic roll and soda-which is great. However there is absolutely no sitting area to sit, no stools-nothing. Only a bar counter where they placed the peppers flakes and parmesan cheese, and the counter was comfortably only fit a total of 6 people (3 on each side) So if u walked around all day and expect to sit and eat-do not count on it.

RNYFv2dN0bVj1JZ4K30dhQ.text: Wow. Great pizza! NY style perfect balance of toppings dough sauce everything. Must try the sausage if you like Italian sausage with plenty of fennel. Don't be fooled with their size and think you are sacrificing quality this is a great pizza. Can't wait  try the margarita a little later on.

qYlwCPJgGhIZFLyyEk18Sw.text: Absolutely loved this place! Heard of this place from my co-worker, and since I love pizza, I had to take a look for myself. If you've had Costco pizza you know how big the slices are, but this place tops it. A single slice is 15 inches. I felt the pricing was more than fair. A slice, garlic knot, and refillable soda for $8.99. I think that is a good value. Pizza was very good, it's thin crust, and the garlic knot was great as well. The women working there had the pinup look which was a good touch. There was a gentlemen by the name of Benji who who as great guy. Everyone there was very welcoming.  I probably would have given this place 4 stars since the seating wasn't that great. Small outside patio section and small standing counter inside. So it did get a little crowded in there considering its 100 outside. But considering there is a walkway to a sports book inside the casino, it regained that star. Pizza and sports. Can't get much better than that. I definitely suggest this place if you are looking for a large slice of pizza with employees who play the part.

7zqchZyzCHTJh3PKRP6lxg.text: Great pizza, served quickly. This place is a tie with Secret Pizza across the street, in my opinion. The $10.99 special for a massive slice, garlic knot, and a beer is a great deal. Highly recommend this place, will be going back when I'm in Vegas again.

RzVATGQTfrvf12Da3zgHkQ.text: We go here every time we're in Vegas. Can be a hit or miss depending on who's making the pizza that day.  One day it's delicious & the next they're leaving it in the oven too long. The slices are huge I think you get your money's worth.

bFH6G3SPPDedevNZ2fR7Pw.text: I was here today - and there are no pretenses -  the pizza is authentic - as a northern Jersey girl I can say that. Greasy some say - what? The best pizza has some oil rolling around. Loved it. Had a slice with sausage (good Italian sausage), a garlic knot and a beer for $11.50. I ate it in the shop standing up and I'm ok with that. Saw them give marinara for other guests. Friendly staff. You should see the size of the pies that make these HUGE slices! Wow. Strongly recommend - I'm going to get one tonight for my 5:30 breakfast ;) - probably the only time they are not open.

wpNRuCcbsJA3AcOn6Zg8gA.text: Ah, so this is the new kid on the Vegas pizza block. Thanks to Yelp, I bookmarked Pin Up for my recent trip. I missed it the evening while navigating Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile, so I made it a mission to find it the following day. It was still early when we got there, so we ordered the Sandra D. combo (slice, knot, soda) which is a reasonable deal. As expected, the pizza and slices are enormous. When ordering, the guy expected us to get in two orders and questioned just the one, but honestly, come on, that big @## slice can't be consumed by one person in one sitting. I mean, yeah, sure it can, but with all the good stuff to try in Vegas, we made this a shareable snack before hitting up other places. The pizza was decent though, and the garlic knot was pretty good for its size. Service was quick, especially since we were able to beat the lunchtime rush. We were just a little confused about where to eat the food. It's a pizza joint, so not a lot of space, but it's standing room only inside and outside, or you can follow the corridor leading directly to the PH sportsbook.

bFBvYGeriUwu1Hl462Bopg.text: Pin Up Pizza was the first pizza we had when we first came to Vegas! It is one of the most affordables at about $6 for a huge slice they put in a box..Which you can share if you like...Because of the affordability...We had them more than once...I would suggest you buy drinks off the strip and keep them in a cooler...Unless you don't mind shelling out $3 per small cup of soda! The location is also great...Right in the middle of the Strip! Great location to people watch...I do not suggest this pizza for people who are looking for healthy! This is more for the hungry...Who want to save money on the Strip.*

Xd-JTZo1YZXkb6fzTXvTpw.text: Love it.  Went for the first time. Slices are huge and the combos are perfect.  Lacking in variety but great traditional flavored.  There are three great New York style pizza places in the heart of the strip.  This one is tied for second best but still great.

R2OCIL8hEFETMEI90o920A.text: The pizza slices are an absolute eye delight!!  The pizza was very good-one slice was all it took.  Ok I did throw in a beer as well!   On a side note, we did ask the pizza place if we could go to the back area to sit and eat which they said yes to.  However,  once back there at a table, we were informed no we needed to sit in the chairs down below as the table sitting area was reserved for restaurant patrons.  Do not sit in the The Ringers Sports Bar and Racing Casino at Planet Hollywood, that area is reserved.  Would be nice to be redirected nicely. So, yes that was a down point for us.  Did not see anyone ordering food nor see anyone moving to sit in the area which we had been sitting in.  The only crowded area was indeed those chairs which we were directed to sit.  So IF you do go to buy pizza, be warned - do not sit anywhere but the crowded chair area.  You will be told to move for non existent restaurant patrons who are not purchasing food from this casino/bar.  Better yet, buy your pizza and stand at the strip window area to watch the people outside!

jG78OKuxUkm9DO8P1a7uLw.text: $5.25 for a huge slice that can feed two people easily. How can you how wrong?!? Plus the taste is awesome. Been here few times and their taste and service is consistent. Service is fast and they have nice selection of drinks. Perfect for on the go walking on the strip or a midnight snack.

TNLsa6X9qwZ4b84fcW70wg.text: This is the worst place I have ever been. Horrible service and management. Literally told the manager on duty how rude the girl was that was taking our order and he acted like it was our fault. Don't go here. It's the pits.

z3ywVDsqj56srBewJhPHFg.text: Pizza bomb af and very big every time I'm out here this is all I eat ... pin up and fat Tuesday my VEGAS diet lol so if u hit vegas the only pizza needed to have is pin up

xktM7sHFW_CFJgRbEvrUTw.text: Yes the slice is big and yes it's a good value. But the pizza is average. We had the big meat and the spinach/artichoke pie. If you're on that end of the strip, worth a try.

VtbTH5PekodcYxBYotYbcg.text: First off, the slices are HUGE! Kinda ridiculous actually, but after a night of drinking, easier to eat most of it than you'd think.  I had a margarita slice and my friend had sausage. Mine was better but was only good hot out of the oven. By the time I got to the middle, it was soggy. The crust end was just ok.  If the whole slice was a good as the first 1/3 of the slice (yes, I said 1/3, I wasn't kidding it was HUGE!) Then I would have given it another star, maybe 2.

cMdW2aCwJK0zusBozReiog.text: Just go eat there--you will not be disappointed if you truly enjoy pizza after a night out !!

PXD3tSXpKaqxYXlJjCVrsw.text: Oh yeah! The best pizza around, next to Planet Hollywood. Hand tossed dough, excellent crust, awesome fresh ingredients. A must try for that late night snack. $10 gets you a large slice of pie, a garlic roll and a soft drink

LpO3N3ySjW-PAMnUXJ-Y5g.text: Pizza isn't bad but they could be friendlier. Also it would be nice to know that ranch is additional when you pay-it is inconvenient to pay extra what you use credit. Service was okay.

nRcrA2dDDbC8KAxjD80WFg.text: Location is ok for the strip. One of the Chicks who takes orders doesn't seem like she likes her job very much. Who can blame her, she works on the strip. But it's cool- Thanks for the "free" ranch when I offered to pay for it even before you told me "WE CHARGE FOR IT, BUT HERE YOU GO"...... Pizzas are huge slices. Ok for on-the-go grub pizza. Get the combo, it's a deal.

tNu_0mWSa_WE5nPHvCLRaQ.text: So cheap, so good! Located near the High Roller, you can enjoy your pizza outside near the beautiful water fountain! I was apprehensive at first because it appeared the pizza was sitting out. However, they cook it upon order and it is fabulous!

5Kax1yWsiO-MeIZbxGBzLw.text: Decent customer service,  fun theme.   The slice is huge and the flavors are good.   The pizza sits under a lamp before reheating.

ss2WYDdUCnW-mi9lpyPFVQ.text: Not totally sure about the hype for this place...  It is basically take-out only.  They have single slices that are huge, and very expensive.  The quality is fine, but nothing exceptional.    Be careful though, the pizza is very hot.  I burned the roof of my mouth and had to deal with that for a few days following.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C3dSe6nyeF5Rt2WZOcRHIw.text: Stumbled upon this place inside of Planet Hollywood. We normally go to Secret Pizza in Cosmo, but I think this'll be our new go-to! Slices are huge! Husband and I shared a pepperoni slice, but one slice is the perfect amount for me if I was hungrier. No seating available anywhere, and I can imagine the struggle during peak times when it gets busy.

viOCPcmthKIbAOZxf7Z60A.text: Who doesn't want pizza after a long ass day of walking, partying, and drinking?   Small establishment at the bottom of planet Hollywood, with a variety of pizzas. The pancetta one was one of my favorites. Order a slice, they will throw it in the oven to warm it up and you're good to go. The slices are huge. 2-3 slices make up a regular large pizza from Pizza Hut.   Kudos to the girls that work here. When it gets busy and they have those customers that can't decide what they want or order 19 different slices in different ways, they keep their cool and are always nice and pleasant to each customer. I was getting annoyed just waiting for the other customer order a bunch of stuff only to change his minds 3 times, tell her they are eating there then turn around and make her box it all up. Y'all the real MVPs.

ZiTnsOM461UcDLcMFYTSmg.text: It was great!! It's also a little hidden pizza joint just like Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan only this pizza tasted wayyyy better!! The slices are much bigger the variety is larger and the line was shorter. My daughter got a prosciutto and arugula slice and it was amazing!!!! We definitely pick Pin Up pizza over Secret pizza!!!

nbxWC7s871DvpJ-3qc66ow.text: Conveniently located around the Planet Hollywood area, reasonably priced specials, large slices, fast takeout service, and friendly service. Open late, until 4 AM. Very tiny spot, and if a line were to form, it could not accommodate it. At best, could not fit more than 6 people. Would not recommend eating here, even if there is a standing section by the window to eat/people watch. Can be uncomfortable with people coming and going in such a cramped space.   Came here for a hearty bite that I didn't have to wait long for: heated it up, boxed it in their giant slice box, and I was on my way.   Plain cheese slice: Thin crust, and perfectly balanced sauce and cheese ratio.  $6  Margherita slice: Yum, so good! Didn't have a lot of sauce, or cheese, but it was OK, since too much of either would not have mixed well with the roasted tomatoes on top. Delicious and colorful, as the tomatoes were red, yellow. Enjoyed the acidic punch. Wasn't much basil on it though. $6.75  Garlic knot: was the biggest disappoint. Not sure what kind of roll they used, but it was soft, and lacked any kind of bite or chew to it. Felt like a cheap store bought potato roll that they slathered some butter on. Didn't even have any garlic taste to it either. If they're going to try to pass off a dinner roll as a garlic knot, at least use some freshly cooked garlic on top! Didn't even finish the one knot I had, and my husband who loves bread and butter, didn't even bother eating the piece I couldn't finish.  $1.25 for single/ $3.25 for 4  Overall, still worth a visit, because they have affordable combos here:  Bettie P. Combo- slice, knot, beet for $11.75 Sandra D. Combo - slice, knot, soda for $9.75  As other Yelpers have said, it's not cheap, but nothing on the Strip is. In comparison, this is probably one of the cheaper options, considering the slices are very long. I would estimate at least a foot if not a bit longer! Also sell cannolis, an assortment of soft drinks, bottled water, beer.   Was really glad I came here for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

499OYINFJr8skR8-euSkdA.text: My mother had told me she wanted to try this place after seeing an ad on Facebook. It was a little hard to find considering it is a small establishment; way smaller than I thought it was going to be. You walk in and it has retro vintage decor with the cashier dressed as a pin-up girl. She was super sweet and welcoming. I can't recall the price but I believe it was $6 for a combo meal- 1 slice and 1 drink.  The slices are HUGE. Definitely bigger than your head. This pizza is very comparable to Villa or Sbarro pizza. It was just very mediocre and nothing crazy. The "wow" factor was the size of the pizza and that's about it. Considering there is only standing room, I would not recommend this place if you are looking to sit down and have a nice meal.

Wrt0JxnpiIWd0wN719E4IA.text: Amazing selections, great combos. Awesome smiling faces. Totally coming back! I had the margherita pizza omg so scrumptious!!!

GV7JnHxWmJ95KA3_jiV_pQ.text: The service was pretty bad. The cashier shoved my order into my chest and essentially told me to get out of the way even tho I hadn't paid yet. It's a deal on the strip, but it is overrated. The fresh mozzarella they use is wonderful, but the execution of the slices is hit or miss.

HTZJ8z-3P0hBGgET7OLa3g.text: Decided to grab a slice after the O show. Went with the chicken & spinach pizza and a garlic knot. The pizza was hot and a bit crunchy. I really liked the spinach on it. The garlic knot wasn't bad.  Will come back and try the margherita pizza or something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Spinach Pizza &amp; Garlic Knot

Euuu6QJ6OGU83xWwvPPlAg.text: This place has some great pizza. You cannot go wrong with a slice of pizza from here from sure. They make these fresh slices  for sure in  front of your face and they have great deals here and the line is long for sure. If you want to come be prepared to be waiting but they are super fast. They are basically on the strip with a outside seating and it's a small place but pizza in this area is awesome. They have great deals for vegetarians and meat eaters with all kinds of pizza. They have cannolis but I wasn't a fan of them they were not that awesome. The main thing to get is like the 10 dollar deal you get  garlic bread knot a slice of your choice veg or meat and you get a soda. Make sure you ask them to give you marinara sauce on the side so you can dip everything in there because it's so tasty and mouth watering. My first time in Vegas trying this place I loved it, I could not on a Sunday express my feeling after being hung over and having a  hot veg cheese slice. My friends got the spinach  and chicken with white sauce and loved it. The price is great there pizza is awesome and it's so thin but there slices are super big. No way in this world you can eat two I do not think so because you might be super full. It was a group of ten people that went with us last time enjoy a soda get a slice they have great deals stand outside in the heat or stand inside eat some fresh hot pizza in there get it crispy and enjoy some really good cheese slices. If  I come back to Vegas and  am walking by this place I'm defiantly  going to go back grab a slice a garlic knot and a soda and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KFLITFiXmzvxOK2R5e_brw.text: I was so excited to go to Vegas and get this pizza after sing it on Facebook. Well they showed a whole pie in the video and there ten of us so we just wanted to buy a whole pie. They wouldn't sell us one and said they only sell it by the piece at $10 each.  We tried to explain ok fine but we want the pie not in a box. Well they can't do that. The reason is there is no place to sit. This is basically a grab and go place. Very disappointed. However there are many good pizza places in Vegas so don't be discouraged just venture on to the next one!

gwXs8o2xy3oIXNkkWNuxXg.text: It was definitely packed on a Thursday night and there was a lady I forgot her name but she had an awesome system to get every customer taken care of! The pizza was delicious and huge! A couple of bites into it I started to feel really full, shit I even had it for breakfast the next day

sV2shitegKEpPcMzCrSqhg.text: Good pizza.  I had the slice with the garlic knot and drink.  Pretty good deal. I went inside the hallways leading into the Planet Hollywood and had a seat inside one of the many tables and then I was asked to leave.  WTF?!? Why is there seats to sit right at the end of that hallway when you're just asked to leave?!!! Not cool Planet Hollylwood ESPECIAllY  when we are paying customers...NOT COOL!

6peVYk-iIjIYYN_FhcYGTQ.text: The slices are HUGE!!! The pizza is pretty good. The garlic knots were nice and soft, good flavor. 4 stars for the seating area outside, there wasn't any... ??? Not a bad price for being on the strip in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h-TX2LSXNegMKlyGkY1nnA.text: Grabbed a massive cheese slice from here for $6.  The pizza has a thin crust and it was decent.    There's no seating options in here but there's a counter looking out onto the strip or head over to the sports book to catch a game.  The sports book option is awesome!  Large slice, drink and multiple sports games on!

QyrUGIEV6ZkG5OpUi8xpzA.text: Went here because I saw it on FB, it's right outside of Planet Hollywood. amazing food, told my other friends, and we came back the next day. Watching the chef toss the big pizza crust in the air was crazy. It's a small place but I think it's really cool. For a slice of pizza, garlic knot and a beer, it's 12 bucks; 10 for a soda instead. I never got something so cheap in Vegas before. The slices are probably 2 1/2 slices in one. You wouldn't think they would fill you up but it does. The pizza is so good and so is the garlic knot. Definitely suggest you going here if you want social media pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

77kbSNH0jkfCBbVQNMPHlw.text: So the pizza is good... yummy, indeed. The only thing that I didn't like was that the trash wasn't picked up regularly. I mean, come on. Pizza is done in the stone oven and comes out nice and crispy. If you come, expect to wait in line for at least 20-30 mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F4U5gMNcpozg0Hdczvsf4w.text: The margarita pizza is great-we added extra sauce. Delish.  The piece is so big my husband and I shared it and was satisfied.  We also  ordered a garlin knot that was glorious-too bad the marinara is cold.  We visited this place 2 times over the time of our little holiday staycation and have had it probably 4 times over the the last month of our Xmas shopping visits.  Good thing the pizza is good because the girl at the front does not like working or working there or both....hot chick who is grumpy looking every time we have visited.  Unfortunate but also understand the place is BUSY too-still no excuse for lack of welcome!  Obviously its worth overlooking but mentioning.  We will be back soon.

QUseTW5mDJX5JN-DtphvAQ.text: You won't find better pizza on the strip. No name at cosmo is great but pin up has it all.  Get the prosciutto "dressed up" and as Ice Cube says it will be "a good day!".  Bernard the chef and Cathy the cashier made the experience first class.

CBnb1lJGgs3WR52ahb9EIQ.text: This is my favorite late night take out on the Strip. Located on the Strip at Planet Hollywood this NY style pizza is A+. While you wait in the long line that moves relatively quickly you are entertained by trying to guess the pin ups ranging from Jane Mansfield to Rhiana. The pizza is par baked in a brick oven and then when you order it they stick your slice on the oven. By the time you pay it is ready. Genius. Last night we had a slice of pepperoni, margarita, and prosciutto with mushrooms. The margarita was my favorite. It was loaded with grape tomatoes that had been marinated in a vinaigrette and married perfectly with the fresh mozzarella.   If you are looking for a late night take out bite this is totally it.

_h8VS6x0SzEQBu33lWhOzw.text: Huge portions! New York style pizza extra crispy not too greasy and delicious toppings. Only disappointment was the lack of toppings on my sausage slice. For the price they should make sure the entire slice is covered!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage pizza. Missing half my toppings! :( delicious sausage but disappointing amount

ZnuVC9mHVl5cfnvZGdDcYQ.text: Customer service was awesome but the pizza was so so. Worth a try tho.kind of lacked flavor.

MKCn8HDEWmQcOYt-9QPdDg.text: Not great pizza. Don't bother trying to sit at the ringer and order lunch it takes for ever the service is horrible.

Ua4-qe0OvwNzX3flr58fDA.text: This is by far NOT the best pizza I have ever had.  Here is why this place gets 5 stars: 1. It is open until 4 am on the Vegas Strip 2. Every slice I have had (I went there about 4 - 5 times during my drinking bender) was amazing (sober or drunk) 3. The slices are huge and 1 should be able to fill up any normal person.  I am not normal so I always get two.  The cheese is fresh, as you can tell by the amazing amount of grease the rolls off the slices as you fold them in half.  They have red pepper, Siracha and other condiments for your pizza eating joy.  And did I mention they were open until 4am?  Find another place that you can get for ~$10, get a great piece of chow, and be on your way in minutes at 3 AM on the strip without having to drive?  There is Denny's but seriously?  After drinking, Denny's is sobering up, at 3 am in Vegas I want to keep it going - so this works great.  You won't be upset if you try it.  The women even dress up in corsets which is funny.

Eusc4u8Hq88sn6Uuz6CKow.text: Three stars! One star each for: FOOD, PRICE and "WILL I COME BACK?" No stars for SERVICE and AMBIENCE.  I got two slices to go. Each slice was HUGE. Ordered a cheese slice and a specialty (ham + potato something) slice. Ate it cold as they ran out of to-go boxes and I had to carry the slices back on open paper plates. Why not eat at the shop? I hear you ask. Well, there is minimal seating (outdoor) and it was early morning. Which meant having to dodge drunk "whoo-hoo!!!" girls as they puke out their sugary pink drinks and pizza. So nope, I grabbed my slices to-go.  Cost about US$15 for two slices. Not bad, considering the location.   I was promised service by "pin up girls". But no such luck. Serving guys behind the counter was brisk and efficient. Two cashier girls spent a few minutes chatting among themselves (probably changing shifts) before one surly asked me what I ordered and ringing me up.  "Will I come back?" Yes. But will be a quick stop to grab and go. Early morning on the Strip is not for the faint hearted.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge pies @ Pin Up Pizza (LV)
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge pies @ Pin Up Pizza (LV)
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge pies @ Pin Up Pizza (LV)

bahAfq67Rq3jcd0ZyhP9eg.text: 1 star because of horrible customer service. I understand you can have bad days, but learn to control your emotions at work. The girl who served us was the cashier who was tatted up and she was not having it today. We heard the pizza was good here so we decided to order almost one of every slice to see what was good. The food was okay, but it doesn't make up the cashier's horrible attitude. At first I was like maybe she doesn't like asian guys, but NOPE she was just rude to everyone that walked in. Was a straight prick to every customer and had so much attitude and sass I regretted ordering and dining in here. Management seriously needs to check up on her behavior... This is straight up something I would see on a tv show like kitchen nightmare with horrible owners. No need to come back here for mediocre pizza. Take your business elsewhere to SECRET PIZZA instead in Cosmopolitan.

PKIBuv2--RdBc1SKm2vWTA.text: Pizza was pretty good, but the wait was sooooo long and wasn't even during a meal time really. For the price, it's a filling meal. Just wish they could find a way to get through the line quicker.

qC9uZdEzH_XLkPtX4uVueQ.text: Line was super long, no where to sit. The pizza...it was all okay. No real flavor and all of them a little dry. The best was the margarita pizza because of the balsamic gave it flavor and not as dry.

z4f1E7ELOvWxCv29ETBCzw.text: The line moved smoothly and the pizza was great.  Yes the place is busy but that's what happens when your restaurant is popular and makes good food

1JlxO9VKvk8stnAyQJjxyQ.text: After a few days of non-stop drinking and after viewing a so-so (damn clouds) eclipse from Harrah's rooftop, we came here as our last meal back to LB.   If you walk here, it's approx. 1 mile from Harrah's to Planet Hollywood. 15-20 mins. to walk??? So you can work off some calories then eat then walk off the carbs again!   NO LINE TODAY at 1pm!   No more patio seating or seats inside this restaurant. Yes, it's hard to find, it's next to the Sportsbook area (waaaaaay in the back of the Planet Hollywood casino) yes just stay to the right and look for the pizza by the slice neon sign. Or if you stay on the outside, walk around the shops and it's next to Pinks hot dogs.   Got me a Bettie P. Combo, $11.75 price as of August 21, 2017, IMO I think it's one of the best meal deals on the Strip. It's good enough to share if you just want to satisfy your appetite or it's good for one hungry person like me!  Only one pin-up girl working today and one chef. I guess it's not too busy during the day compared to evenings and after hitting up the clubs.  Just get the meatball-pepperoni-pancetta-Italian sausage pizza. With beer. With the solo garlic knot. The best cure-all! Deeelish NY style cheesy thin crust pizza. Not too saucy and that's good for me otherwise the heartburn would've been in overdrive.  I've been to NYC a few times but this is without the attitude!!!!   Just ask for the pizza box cause I think the plate is pointless.....or they should serve it on parchment paper. Ate the huge-ass slice in the sportsbook area while watching the soccer games. No big deal.

ev36jbtnmLWcN93Q1kIVmw.text: ITS LIKE IM IN NEW YORK. The pizzas are so nicely thinned, not overly sauces, not too salty. It was delicious. Not too much grease left behind on the box. AND LETS TALK ABOUT THE SIZE IT WAS BIGGER THAN MY THIGHS. If you think Costco pizza slices are huge, think again.

yBsUpiVFpWp-K2abVZVMLg.text: Super happy I followed the advice of fellow Yelp-ers and tried Pin-Up pizza - it was a lot better than I was expecting! I got the margarita pizza and the tomatoes were so, so good; sweet and juicy! I only got the slice of pizza (which I thought was a steal for $7 considering the size), but in hindsight I would have sprung for a coke and garlic knot, too- they looked pretty good!

xhKICowvWTBqLA4DiguqcA.text: "...that's what she said."  Yeah yeah, keep the jokes coming because that pizza is MASSIVE!    Pin Up Pizza is located outside of Planet Hollywood next to Pink's Hot Dog.  It's a small shop with an indoor and outdoor stand up counters to eat.  Pizzas run for less than $6 a slice!  Where they get you is the price of beverages.... $3 for a 16 oz soda??   I got the spinach artichoke pizza.  There were huge chunks of artichoke and some spinach scattered around.  It was a little bland but nothing like some Italian seasoning and chili flakes to do the trick.  The pizza holds its form well so you can hold it without worrying about the toppings sliding off from a floppy pizza. Bonus!  Open until 2AM.  Pin Up Pizza is worth checking out for a quick and inexpensive meal that will definitely hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Artichoke Pizza $6.
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge pizza in the making!

wCKJViPCmBfwKjKaUIPtAA.text: Not the best, not the worst pizza. Nice large slices, good for the cost. Quick service, good atmosphere. The pizza just wasn't that great. The taste was a bit off, the flavors just didn't really meld together well; some adjustment to the recipes and it could be good pizza. Since it's twice baked, crust was hard.

3bhadQyGimupNWD9mGu9kw.text: My fav pizza joint when I'm in vegas!!!! My brother showed me this place!!!   Now it has become tradition of ours to stop by Every time we visit.   All the pizza's are delish and HUGE!!!   Check in thru yelp and get a free Miller!! :)   I Haven't tried the garlic knot i am waiting for my next visit to try it!!!

MZL1kWTyztRl8uyUSdqjMA.text: Grabbed a slice of pepperoni pizza here. The pizza was super thin but crisp and very large! When you walk in you are greeted by a staff who asks what you'd like to order. Since I just ordered a slice she took the slice from the pizza out from the display case and heated the pizza in the oven. The order also came with a garlic bread which was fluffy and sooo buttery, I loved it!  This place is pretty small. There is no seating inside but there are a few seats and tables outside. Sitting outside can be disturbing because birds come to feast on any crumb or leftover

YoRdpZt4nv0mKvbAutskcA.text: What can i say about this place?? Its pizza, a giant slice of pizza! Overall the combinations of pizza were great! Not to saucey yet still alot of flavor! Only bad thing about this place is the wait. But what can you expect from being a restaurant on the strip. Although it was fairly fast they only had 2 people working. But, i will definitely come back for a slice in sin city.

x-cb0Ue06xNHYq4dTRSRPA.text: Not bad! I was pleasantly surprised.I went in for a quick slice and really had mediocre expectations. But instead he pizza was good to OK!  I got their Margherita pizza which was bit really classic Margherita by definition. It was a white pizza with fresh mozzarella, grape tomatoes and basil. The crust was good but not life changing, the fresh mozzarella tasted good but was not cut thin enough or spread across the pie.  Normally this would be a 2 star review but the crew and the decor of the place gave them that edge to a 3 star.  Would I go back?  Yes.  Would I tell friends, oh my God, you need to try this place. Not likely.  Good place in a pinch. But it going out of my way to go there.

_zfM6jngS81kHcUSZfFvlQ.text: This place was so gooooood! My kids are picky about pizza, pizza sauce etc. And my kids loved it, it was very good,  Huge slice and the garlic buns things were great.  Going to come here every time we come to vegas.

L3in3OQ7JpHPj_GcHAek_w.text: I was so excited to try this place and I was disappointed. Ok pizza slice is huge, but the taste meh, I've had better . Would I go again, definitely not.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

51ekRLFea7IH_WqHLLrAUQ.text: went here on vacation this weekend and i was super excited to try it because i love pinup! i got a cheese slice and i prefer little caesars or costco pizza over this stuff. people must be REALLY drunk to think its any good! the garlic knots are delicious but not the pizza. the customer service seemed great until i got to the cash register and the cashier was very rude she kept staring at me with this really off-putting look on her face that made me not want to even purchase the food. i believe her name was stefany? a customer came over and asked her a question and she was very rude when she replied. our garlic knot took 10 minutes longer than our pizza? made no sense. a slice is $6 and they're super huge but was not happy with the flavor. i wouldn't go back.

uh7Kx0mct-BFsH9aEUmVFw.text: They use The best flour there is for pizza...... "Antimo Caputo 00" ..... Fantastic pizza.....

C8M5fiLVLjMUJWI4_6wvyA.text: Pizza was good service was awful. Toni the cashier had an attitude through the whole transaction. At the end when we went to grab the pizzas she slapped our hands away and told us to wait until. We are all grown adult we do not need to be told to wait to grab our food because she does not know how to her job.

Yl9cZjejl8EHDAUnreIMCg.text: This place was awesome! The pizza was phenomenal, thin toasty, extra large slices and the ingredients were top notch. While we were there, Chef Dominic treated us like family. This was an all around great environment. Oh and the garlic rolls were outstanding!

-vTqDjFg6uoLT98t-FM-1A.text: Best pizza on the strip!!! Large slices - Great prices - Cold beer and Fantastic Cannoli !!!!!! TWO THUMBS UP FOR Chef Wardell Freeman!  A MUST stop on the strip.

aSjBh8874qDLJVUn7f0R2A.text: This was really good pizza. The slices are huge and hot from the oven.  It is really a take away place on the strip located in front of Planet Hollywood casino. There is a place to stand inside and outside with umbrellas for shade, but no seats. If you are looking for a nice slice of pizza at a reasonable ( for the Vegas Strip) price try Pin Up Pizza.

UQNY5_rpe-cacIqWlJvL7w.text: The pizza is excellent, service is fast and good most of the time. Convenient they are open til 4 am as well

ZNfkdvBrQ2is1fx24_KNKg.text: The food as well as the service was incredible! Great prices and giant slices of pizza make for a great meal on the LV Strip!

pmoIqB95Nw0lZ06SRG9W9w.text: The pizza is delicious. A flavorful sauce and good New York style pizza. They heat up your slice for you so it is hot and fresh. The cashier unfortunately did not match the quality of the food. My husband signed the credit card slip and handed it back to her. As he was signing I was getting the cash for the tip jar. She looked at the card slip and muttered "ugh, so kind" when she saw the 0 tip. Well there went the tip. I'm not tilling a cashier that makes snide comments and never even so much as smiled or used a friendly customer service oriented tone. 5 star pizza and 1 star service.

jKjggoEOFT5uE_YwtT7itA.text: Big slice a knot and a beer!! Where can you go wrong! Tight squeeze to order your pizza but if your lucky to be in line with a bunch of drunk happy people makes it fun!      Great crust and real bacon!! We have ate pizza at multiple locations And will be back to this one!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KPaFGyU42jr2xhMeus4cig.text: Giant slices of pizza! For the price you can't beat it & greasy pizza is a great hangover cure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those are some nice size slices!

511pWGNutbP88rQkD_XqWA.text: We stopped by here for a late night tired as hell ready for bed but need to eat stop. We stayed at PH so location was just outside the Mile Shops facing the Cosmopolitan side. There was a line about 8 deep but loved pretty quickly. They have an option to get a meal deal with a slice, a garlic knot & soda for $10.25 I think. I opted for a pepperoni slice $7, prosciutto arugula $7, & (4) garlic knots for $3. They pop them into the oven to crisp it up and voila you are on your way. Overall the pizza was okay, nothing special, just huge slices but it wasn't bad either. It's a reasonable meal and the service was quick and friendly for as fast paced as it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8qs6dXJr7xx25v_FZJoXew.text: This is right by Planet Hollywood. I was kind of dying and needing some fuel after a huge AYCE dinner the night before and skipping breakfast and lunch today. So after walking the Las Vegas Strip for hours I decided not to pass out and get something that was Vegas and something that was a good deal.   Good deal for the strip shops it was. $10.25 for a Huge Slice+knot+soda. I got the meat slice. BTW your slice is taken out of a 30" pizza! The gal taking the order and ringing up was super cool (she has a ton of cool tattoo work done also). I didn't get her name but she was definitely great at giving excellent service. If you are lucky, you will get her in the evening.  I read a lot of complaints about the late night service and long lines. That is to be expected due to the burgeoning crowds that descend on the Strip at night.   I got there around maybe 6pm and stood at their inside strip table and ate. There is an outside L-shaped strip table too. Very little room and no seating. The pizza was a little better than average with a decent smattering of toppings. The crust was tasteless so I tossed it into the river (JK!) :-)  They have a good selection of slices like for instance the margherita, pancetta and mushroom, cheese, spinach and cheese and more.   They have a really cool box shaped like a slice but big enough to fit your giant slice. I did not need one as it is only for to-go orders. Again, the gal who helped me was superb and very nice. I would rate them a 3.5 and the half goes to that girl who was bomb. Other than that it is a good novelty. The pizza rates a 3 or 3.5. I have to lean on a 3 rather than a 4 as it has to to be compelling for me or I round down. It would be great if Yelp would add a 1/2 star option but I don't think that will happen as they want to keep it simple. All in all, if you are hungry it is a good value and does the job. Not awesome but not anywhere bad either.

_fiqw1BiONzDB0j3wBs3jw.text: After watching some YouTube videos of where to eat on strip, we had to try it. For $10 you get a large, let me say this again a laaaaharrrgggeeee slice of pizza, a garlic knot and a beverage.  The pizza is very good and filling.   Only complaint is standing room only, no tables or chairs to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w3SnQ39dpAOUVIzYCLURIA.text: I'm out here in a California. Wishing they had more locations. The pizza's they make are seriously delicious. Just the right amount of crust, cheese and toppings. This goes for all the pizza's I've tried there. Definitely going to stop by for another slice when I visit Vegas again.

9oKl_-Pnjuh8jTeqrvnOAQ.text: Pin Up Pizza is actually pretty good. I tried a slice of pepperoni and their dough is almost perfect. It was post cooked to perfection by Tiffany, where the dough was crispy along the crust and chewy on the inside. The pepperoni tasted more like a salami though. I would have given this place 5 stars, but at 1:20am on a Saturday. This restaurant has a beautiful Pin Up Girl working all alone, doing everything by herself. Tiffany was taking orders, putting pizza slices in the oven, folding pizza boxes, handling the register, and boxing and delivering pizza with a smile. It was so incredible to watch such spectacular woman. While 3 supposed cooks lean against walls and wait to slowly fill empty pizzas.

HSNbR72rwQXKuBKPBZE6-Q.text: Decent New York style pizza right on the strip. A little bit hard to find but tucked in next to the Planet Hollywood casino. Very small place with just a counter to order and a standing bar to eat. No tables or seating. Good prices. I had a huge slice of pizza, bread knot, and soda for about 10 dollars. Plenty to fill you up.

7BGbAnAqNXil25OfKyxKtg.text: The food was decent (nothing special besides the size) and a great price for the strip - although average price anywhere else. My slice was a little burnt though :/ I also didn't realize they only have a stand up bar outside, no seats. Overall I would say it's alright if you happen to be in the area (shopping at miracle mile) and instagramable , but not worth the drive/parking hassle for a local. Very okay

eM8Fe_yL5jq6ITVYCb2N8g.text: Another joint that should NEVER come up on Yelp, particularly 4th, when I am seeking Gluten Free Pizza. They have none. I guess it's not their fault but they should not be listed under GF pizza. Someone at Yelp should figure this out.

rO4ykU72eRjSp6dIzq8UNQ.text: Great experience! The pizza was delicious! We got two combos and an extra slice. Our favorite was the prosciutto and arugula. Unfortunately, they were out of cannolis  will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OPVQbmztcHmiUtACSt4v0w.text: I am only reviewing their garlic knots. The sister and I were craving for something bready and took a pit stop here. Omg, I could gobble those bad boys down and eat like 20 of them because they're so soft, moist garlicky and buttery.

tEjHxMHG6tt0ov7JUgL_mw.text: Very busy, crowded and noisy place. We came there around 10 pm and we stood in line for 10 min. The slices of pizza are huge,  and delicious. I loved the design of the place. The seating outside is very limited and they had no boxes to go. So there is no sitting outside and no boxes to go, what your customers suppose to do? This is what exactly happened to us. If you guys know how popular you are you should have sufficient amount of boxes for those who want to take out. Also it is very tiny and squishy, very inconvenient. On top of that there is no restroom inside. The staff is not polite, they want you out as soon as possible. So no wonder I wanted to be out as soon as possible.

UhK8f99In_5863F2QBL0cQ.text: Large slices. Nice clean restaurant. Good price point. But the pizza was very good.  I'm a big fan of pizza was a little disappointed by there's plenty of other places in Vegas to try.

uBsHuEIcwGOuHfI29KSq3g.text: This was quite the pleasant find near Planet Hollywood, offering some delicious pizza that really helped end a nice night on the strip. The margherita pizza featured fresh heirloom tomato, mozzarella, and a good amount of basil. The portion is huge, meaning one slice is more than enough to fill you up.   The one issue I had was that adding arugula and balsamic costs another 2.25, when you can get it on certain pizzas for the same price as the margherita (7.00 a slice). I'm already getting one of the only meat-free pizzas on the menu and you're going to charge me more for cheaper ingredients?

yKfo8YVc8zl5e9oNbjYhWQ.text: The best pizza on the strip. Workers kept it together no matter how long the line was. Nice pizza, knot and beer combo. Late hours for night owls. You won't be disappointed. A must visit for us while in Vegas. I recommend a slice of the big meat or the chicken and spinach....

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big meat pizza with a garlic knot on the side.

S5QjCzGc2dV0bLAyPHNONw.text: Great pizza! I normally like a thicker crust but this giant thin crust slice was excellent. I ended up going twice during my Vegas trip. First time was the big meat slice. I liked it but I didn't like one of the meats on it but still good. Second time I ordered the combo slice knot and a pop. The slice was pepperoni and it was great greasy crispy goodness. Knot was soft and good but nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pin-Up pepperoni slice and knot. Dollar for size reference.

n1b4mvUDrNnSXkXNXbzXZA.text: Pizza was ok poor lady was by her self they ran out of a lot of things. Good for late night quick bite.

nd5LQ9QecPomwercRPJPGw.text: A tiny little place right outside the hard rock hotel. No inside seating, there is only a long table you can stand at. The pizza is gigantic! Pick your flavor and they will heat it up for you. One slice is about $7. I really enjoyed the crunchy crust. We got the mushroom and bacon one. It has almost full slices of bacon on it. We pulled them apart, bc it made biting into the pizza a bit of a challenge. Overall the pizza was good, nothing super special. I wouldn't mind going back, but wouldn't go out of my way to do so.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perspective.

4PrCllZB9TYZ2zSFbfOqsg.text: We picked up Pin-Up Pizza as a late-night fix for a no dinner evening. I had read up on this shop prior to visiting Vegas and was excited to try it after all the great reviews. NO. Just NO. Yes, it's a slice the size of a Volkswagon Beetle. But it tastes AWFUL. I bought a slice of pepperoni and when I opened the container, it was clearly old and dried up. It tasted TERRIBLE. Not even worth $7 and the time I wasted getting it. Yuck.

j66XqBI_FYgftQdciUhCxw.text: This pizza is okay tasting, but I ordered the margherita pizza and the tomatoes were really good. I think the size of the pizza is just enough to satisfy a hungry stomach. The pizza is good, but it's nothing outstanding. :)

dz2GKsZrPOlHD6qOMWTR2A.text: Good little pizza shop on the strip. Huge pizzas and long lines, but worth the wait. Definitely worth a trip.

GRuws3eRSJDatunjLKM7Bg.text: Hands down my favorite pizza in the USA!! I love the whole pin up theme so visiting here was a must and so glad I did. I absolutely love the pizza and the garlic knot was not tiny at all and was soooo fluffy and light on the inside. Staff was gorgeous and friendly. Biggest pizza I've ever seen offered for sale and yes you can purchase their pizzas as a whole though they typically have a variety of offerings made that you order by the slice and I think it's adorable they call that welcome mat a slice.... it was hanging off the plate in piping hot deliciousness on every angle and topped with a garlic knot bigger than my fist. Be staring or plan to share!!  This area of dining is a hard one especially in LV because there so so many great places to choose from and great pizza joints across the US but I can say with ease this is the best!  I cannot wait for my next visit back to LV and I tell everyone who goes to stop by and grab a slice they will not be sorry

aSF1a_SVTz141zHzxiH7ZQ.text: These slices are huge! Perfect if you're hungry and aching to get back to the debauchery that is Las Vegas! For less than $10 you can get a Sandra Dee combo with a huge slice, garlic knot, and a soft drink. Or grab a Betty P combo with a beer instead of a soda. Overall you can't go wrong. They have different slices to choose from: all meats, veggies, Margherita (the best - marinated tomatoes, basil, delicious) and more! Seems that everything is made fresh. You can see the cooks at work kneeding and flipping the dough! You have to check out PinUp!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k-1NE1I0r0eGHDVNeyqhUg.text: At the strip by Planet Hollywood. The biggest slice of pizza.  Ordered Bettie P combo (a slice of meat pizza, garlic knot and a bottle of Corona). That's LV strip experience.

e0JtBrNJ3nxcbpHbp-sPBw.text: Pretty good standing room only pizza place.  The slices are over-sized and the prices are pretty good for Vegas.  They have a combo with a garlic knot and beer for $12.  Just be prepared to eat standing up or possibly go into the Miracle Mile shops where you can find plenty of seating!

vmUHaM_EWADY3sHAI2lLWw.text: For the price you pay for a slice it's amazing. Decent amount of food, prompt service, line structure in place. All cooked fresh, but gets reheated as the line moves so you're still getting nice fresh hot pizza. Only thing I'd complain about is the lack of standing area to eat your food. But highly recommend the food.

gljOnfY0mouXHxWxzjt-4g.text: This was prob the worst pizza I have ever had. Very little to no sauce or toppings. I knew it was cheaper pizza but I expected it to be a edible. I would pass on this pizza. If your really hungry and in the area Pinks Hotdogs is right next door.

YYXw35dR4AWfH--pf0UkPw.text: Great presentation, but VERY little flavor and very high prices.  This pizza was definitely not worth what seemed like a mile long journey just to get to the location.

QUdao03pQi25VHf3opHIpw.text: Great large pizza here. Definitely a novelty but it was really good to try at least once!

P5d9EL07zX1nMxXNNTap0Q.text: How does this have 4 Yelp stars??  The pizza wasn't good by any means.. only edible.  The price was great and the slice huge so there was good potential but it definitely fell short.  No reason at all to eat here with Pink's right next door.

g2EvHFi_xPSmqTV0L2woMw.text: Honestly, haven't even tried the pizza before this review, but as a business owner, the customer service was phenomenal, even at late hours.  Tiffany was insanely attentive and professional. Absolute all star. Keep up the great work!

upqkS8C6l6RkBod56q0b0g.text: Always a great experience and great food coming here, unfortunately this time the service was horrible. Cashier was very rude for no reason at all. We were very polite, but she must've been having a bad day. Requested to speak with a manager and she gave me the hotel number and said I could give them a call and take it up with them rather than just calling a manager for me.. very unfortunate but pizza was great as always!

5vFzjz19L6KyFAQZeQ4nLg.text: Yes, this place typically has a long line, but it's quick and well worth the wait for $7. The slices are huge and thin crusted. The prices are clearly listed. Hence, don't order weird shit and your pizza will be delicious.

Etz2mkl3wh9vuVtOqmp_bw.text: Great pizza, tasted very light. It was fun to have the biggest slices on the strip. Very reasonably priced.

ctCI7-DU0vR3Zy9wvSdsag.text: Pin Up pizza was on our list of eats because of the size of the slices. We waited 15-20 minutes to order our slices. The pizza was very good and worth the wait if you have the time, but if you're in a rush, then you may want to move on. The staff was friendly and was trying to move as fast as possible. However, the process could have been much faster if someone assisted the cashier.

_4bj-X5U_qcMXqDHahE4_A.text: I have no clue why there are honestly so many poor reviews. The pizza is by far one of the best slices of pizza I have ever had. It is absolutely MASSIVE, and definitely is larger than my forearm. The service was just as wonderful. There is no seating in Pin-Up Pizza, however, if you walk down their hallway, it leads you into a sports bar where you can sit at a table, enjoy your pizza, and some sports. I would certainly recommend this place to anybody!

I8WlvvHxjc8yUxRyp0j2hA.text: This place is Great, Pizza has great flavor they just need to stay open later! It is Vegas!!!

N_5qranGpZpO34MlXUljRg.text: Good Food bad service. Line was a long wait and ordered food and paid asked the cashier for it to be in box for I can take it to go and she got mad gave me a attitude and thru all my food in the box. She told me they have a shortage on boxes so don't eat anywhere on property since I got a box.

PkIyQLyHZREu-37i7zpWuQ.text: After seeing this pizza place on FB, we had to try it while in Vegas. There was a line and we had to wait about 10-15 mins which I didn't have a problem waiting. It was kinda exciting just being there and watching the guy toss the dough and we met some really fun people while standing in line! The chicken and spinach pizza was really good, much better than I expected after reading other reviews. The staff was really nice and polite. If you like pizza then go check out this spot. It's a cool experience! Being that we are in Vegas often, I will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wl3VNI_J61_g9NglEysBNQ.text: Enjoyed their giant pizza two times in one day. Went for lunch and craved it again at 1:00 am after a night of partying. Great food

3x67it7SaNQvLYHMrNQ02Q.text: Be prepared to make at least 20 minutes of line, 2 combos offered, the difference is the drink(soda or beer).  I'm pretty positive that what it sells there is just the presentation of the pizza, because on terms of taste there's way more better pizza out there. So if you want to fill up your IG's with a giant pizza... this is a good place.   Forgot to mention that the knots are way better tasty than the pizza  Will try it again, depending on the waiting line of course.

Es-abgcponiwQJumAmBfOA.text: "Bringing New York to Las Vegas" is what they're about. Huge thin crust pizza slices which was exactly what I was looking for one late drunk night.   Ordered the pepperoni and thinly sliced meatball pizza slice. Came up to a couple cents short of $8. The crust was crispy and crunchy and had good flavor. Definitely hits the spot when you want a slice of pizza. Service was friendly and super fast.   The slice was HUGE. Could probably share with another person as well since I was pretty damn full after having the entire slice.  Would I be back? Definitely

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Up close and personal with the pepperoni and meatball pizza slice -$8
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge slice

i_j_DN76obRCg2oaB8Xu6g.text: Wowza. Perfect pizza. Great flavor. Huge slices. Inexpensive (for Vegas standards at least)

8Ke926mzU0IlNYszSAqDjw.text: Great location and fast service! Pizza slices are huge and the flavors are decent. Has two entrances and you're greeted with friendly service even in those late wee hours.

wfB7yJgY4kOZvTokyAJYlA.text: The pizza is okay and the staff has a little attitude. I read reviews on this place and wanted to try it. The slice was gigantic but the taste is average.

VWHzajl22A4zJCBywVXRJA.text: Quick service! Big slice of pizza that could feed two for under $7. I had the margherita slice, which consists of mozzarella and cherry tomatoes. Simple, but so good!! The garlic knot was good as well. Must have pizza when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita with a side of garlic knot

7MUt78E10RFVtPxAKePQeQ.text: When hubs said he wanted to come here, I was thinking this was a Twin Peaks sort of place.  I was as happy as he was disappointed to find the employee fully clothed.  We got the garlic knot (the size of my fist!) and a slice of margherita.  I thought it was a little expensive, but you do get a humongous slice.  I really thought that this was going to be all gimmick with no delivery, but I was wrong.  The tomatoes were fresh and juicy, and the moz was cut thick and had wonderful texture.  The bread was thin like Italian style but had more crunch to it; very delicious.  If I want to be picky, I'd say that the oil making riveluts down my slice was over much, but you don't come here looking for healthy options.  The garlic knot was soft and flavorful, but the headliner was clearly the pizza.  IMHO, this place bests Secret Pizza and I will return to try the other slices.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $8!

XHE7ukqiBfkRMAQ6crPjrA.text: This place was just ok. The slices are ridiculously big which I think is the only real appeal. The pizza was fine. Nothing I'd go back for. It's cool if you just want an ig photo or something though. The cashier was super nice and friendly though, even though it was crowded and crazy she remained so friendly to everyone ! !

SWrHuWuXZnGTy5odosHUwg.text: This is a pretty good spot that is actually on the strip for a slice of pizza. The slice here are pretty big and will hit the spot, but for those with a bigger appetite, get the combo, which includes a drink and their garlic bread (knot). The slice always hits the spot for me. Its located right outside of Planet Hollywood along the strip and have a back way into the sports betting area. The workers here are friendly and sweet. They lay out of of the pizza parlor is cute, with pin up girl pictures everywhere. Its definitely worth a go if you are craving a slice on the go!

6-IMuPIHr25Di594BrvQmg.text: Terrible, overrated gimmick.  This is my first Yelp review ever.  I figure it's mycivic duty to provide a  public service to make sure you know how bad this pizza is.   Do not waste your money.  Hey pin up pizza, how about taking a day or two and actually try and come up with a decent product that doesnt taste like spicy cardboard?  That would be awesome, wouldn't it?  Ugh...rant over.

qWufxj-Cp5B0Dr1KQRAJOQ.text: Register lady was rude. Customer in front of me asked where he can get some napkins. Register lady said "there should be some behind you". Where 13 people were standing and eating.  Impossible to get people to move to get napkins... But he went and there was not any napkins.  Her response was "well I guess we don't have any". RUDE B****...    so this customer, myself, and many others have no napkins because of this incompetent employee....    STAY AWAY

ucn4Q5k3GS2PERI84xnMOQ.text: I immediately was disappointed with this place because of your employee Candace . Candace has a nasty attitude and needs to be written up or fired . She made it very clear when I said I'm telling your manager you got an attitude with me and my friends for putting red pepper and cheese on our pizza at the register where the containers were sitting . I guess it's too much to ask politely could we move the containers where they belong and someone mistakenly set them at the register . She said she does not care if I report her . It's clear she hates her job . My friends told her we are all in service industry and would never disrespect customers in that way . The pizza was good but I was upset the entire time so I will never go back again . And I told All 5000 of my friends on Facebook and friends that visit Vegas not to go because of Candace . Customer service should be number one .

1chqS3pgZ87jtV5xaq_QEA.text: Everything looks better than it appears.  Just my opinion.  I had the meat slice with the garlic knot.  It was pretty dry.  They don't give you anything to dip for the knot either.  The girl behind the counter was quick, but not friendly at all.  Really no customer service, just service if you know what I mean.   The nice thing here is you can take the pizza straight into the sports book and watch the races and games.

BeJAUAaRoD71hi6UGaA-9w.text: I enjoyed the experience! Being able to get a big slice of pizza and actually be good. I had seen this place on Facebook and YouTube and other social media sites. Everyone said It was good and a need to try place. It was good but not a need to try place. You actually go for the experience of being able to put a picture on instagram or Snapchat. As for a need to try eh I mean there is other places that you can try. Overall the pizza was good though. I had the pepperoni slice and I tried the prosciutto and arugula. The crust was thin and crunchy but soft inside. The sauce was not over powering and had good flavoring. The pepperoni slice had a good amount of meat on it. The prosciutto one was my favorite!! Make sure you get all the fixings if not then why get it? They add arugula tomato's and vinaigrette. That puts it over the top. I got lucky when we went in my wife and I only waited a little over 20 mins. I would say if no line then go get yourself a slice but as to wait in a long line and wait then maybe look for another spot......oooo if you go in during the day mind you the sun hits them directly so it might be a little hot when eating on the counter inside.
