1RRf5msk1iVjEqvxKgqUGQ.text: This is probably the biggest slice of pizza I've ever had in my life!  The crust is very thin so you don't feel overly full after eating a slice of Pin-Up Pizza and it is served fairly hot. I tried the Margherita pizza and it was very yummy. They offer two different meal options - one with a slice of pizza, a soft drink and a garlic knot and the other with a slice of pizza, beer and a garlic knot. Further, they are open till very late so it's perfect if you are walking back to the hotel hungry after the club! There is no area for sitting but they have high tables/bar outside and inside where you can just stand and eat your pizza. They also offer a box for the pizza slice if you want to get it to-go. Keep in mind - this is fast food and it is good for being fast food. I recommend you give Pin-Up Pizza a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0pIdqJAchfj8FJYB5yz0Vg.text: The woman at the register was not exactly polite nor was she friendly. The entire time we stood eating our food she had no personality with anyone that came through.  The pizza was ok. They make very large pizzas and when you order they reheat it in the oven. Very crispy and large slices. The garlic knots were quite good and a decent size as well. The marinara was good just a small container for .75. The deal for a beer, pizza and knot was about $12.75 which isn't too bad considering the amount you get. The margarita pizza was good just the tomatoes were pretty tart. The pepperoni was good just greasy but what pepperoni pizza isn't? They offer red pepper flakes and garlic salt to put on top.  The downfall, other than the woman with no personality, is there is no where to sit. Standing room only and outside they have a very small area that is also standing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JHBZ4cL2J5EhqFOkAPOIrg.text: If you happen to be on the strip near Planet Hollywood, and need a filling slice of pizza, Pin-Up Pizza is a great choice. There is access from the sports book within PH or the main entrance from the strip between main entrances to PH/Miracle Mile.   Make sure you've worked up a bit of an appetite (drunken or not) because these slices are no joke. They don't even fit on the plate so plan on taking a few immediate bites of gooey cheese (watch out, it's probably hot!) or your server may even fold the pizza tip over on itself to avoid excess pizza issues. The $7 price point may seem high, but one slice is equivalent to at least two regular slices anywhere else!  Their pizza is best right out of the oven, so I wouldn't recommend trying to save it for later. Once you order, they throw your slice right into the oven, which is why there is usually a bit of a line. Everyone walks out with a freshly warmed slice of pizza.  Out of a handful of visits here, I've tried the pepperoni, prosciutto and arugula, and margherita. The prosciutto and arugula is probably the most different of them all. The arugula, cherry tomatoes, and sauce are added after the pizza is warmed. The toppings are plentiful and this one can get a little messy. Pancetta and mushroom has become my go to. The combo of fatty pancetta and mushroom is unbeatable and creates a well balanced, simply delicious pizza.   Earl's used to be my favorite cheap eat on the strip, but Pin-Up Pizza makes me forget that Earl's is only a few more steps away. Plus, my husband never lets me skip an opportunity to come here.

jM5X-cbZh23u5vq2twsPRA.text: The hype on this place is UNREAL!  The pizza is pretty good, I've had better. But the size of the slice is what stole my heart!  Next time I'm getting the full pizza...cause who doesn't want a gigantic body sized pizza to Mac on all night long?   I got the pepperoni slice and it's pretty tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big ole slice

Dbp3dFI5ZyKVTJyCRXSOoQ.text: Need a food break from being drunk and/or walking the strip? This is the drunk stop for pizza forsure. The building is tiny, so it isn't ideal to eat inside. It's literally only large enough for a small line to form inside. You order your pizza, pay, and slide on down to the other end of the tiny room to retrieve your order.   My boyfriend and his family ordered a slice of pepperoni per person, while I opted to go for 2 garlic knots. The food was served nice and hot, and even though it was reheated technically, it still was delicious. We took it back to the Bellagio and enjoyed it there where it was still pretty warm. The pizza is a thin crust of sorts and definitely a gigantic piece. The cheesy was melty and the tomato sauce evenly distributed throughout the slice. The garlic knots were fantastic, and it didn't even need marinara. Fluffy, soft, garlicky, and amazing.   A quick, delicious munchies spot. The pricing is fair for both quality and size. Service was speedy and courteous. Not a bad place to check out.

_EEOzm7pHpdwCD6-RibZhg.text: I was craving a new york-style slice late at night, so we went here.   PROS: It's located on the strip, and the pizza slice is big and hot. I did like the homemade meatball though.  CONS: the sauce is Bland, there's not enough cheese, and the crust is too thick for my taste.  This place has a standing room only eating area, so beware of the homeless people asking you for change along the strip while you're eating your New York style pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

reojQLk_iB26N4b-9BW2Vw.text: Huge pizza slices! 1 slice could actually feed 2 people. Good service and cute restaurant.  Pizza was okay - it needs more flavor, crust was crunchy and cheese was good. I ordered the prosciutto and mushrooms - some mushrooms were total burned. (Disappointed)  It's a good place for quick bite of a huge pizza slice.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IHZOfUjY5MUNGvTBOcDqQw.text: Lets be honest for one second. Imagine yourself in Las Vegas... you have been gambling all day and all night. You look down at your watch and you see it now 1am and you forgot about dinner. Its happened to me and seeing as you are in Las Vegas, we know its happened to you. Or better yet, your machine or dealer was starting to pay out  Well...sadly...even though a lot of places are still open for dinner, a lot of them are closed. And you just want Pizza. Who doesn't want pizza? Well, luckily this is the place to go.   Pin Up Pizza. Right on the strip by Planet Hollywood or across the street from Bellagio. It is open very late and the pizzas are no joke, they are bigger than your plate. Think of New York but even bigger. Well, that could be False since I have never been to New York to enjoy their pizza but that is another story for another time.   Anyways, back to this location. It is very small shop and can only hold a few people at a time while waiting for your food. There is a counter to eat inside and a counter to eat outside. The lady that was working the counter was very quick and talented. You know this place is good when there is a long time out the door but she took the orders of ~10 people at a time since she will use up all the space in the pizza oven. There is a line, yes, but it will be a quick line. Besides...I would rather wait in line with other people so I know the food is good....verses no line where I question the food is good or bad.   There are many different times of flavors besides your traditional pepperoni, or sausage, or cheese. I got the pancetta and mushroom and it was good. My wife got the prosciutto and arugula and she enjoyed it. There was a drizzle of balsamic glaze (I think) on top.   Overall, if I am ever to return to this place, I will return here.

qfDrvo_ae7SLyJGUZru2JQ.text: I stayed at Planet Hollywood from July 7th to July 9th and found Pin Up Pizza to be one of the more affordable dining options.  $23.27 was enough to get two large slices of pizza, two garlic knots, and two sodas.  Each slice was boxed individually and the corresponding garlic knot was placed in the same box as the slice.  The sodas were poured into plastic cups but lids and straws were not provided.  Although environmentally conscious, this made it more challenging to carry all of the items back to the room without spilling the drinks.  The food was hot and very tasty.  Pin Up Pizza was mostly a carry-out spot with only a little standing room outside and no seating.  The slices were at least twice the size (if not more) than the slices you would find at a major chain pizza place.  I saw the food go right in the oven while I was waiting in line and an employee was stretching dough nearby.

m6_6H916NbBZioyV1nCReA.text: It seems so obvious.  In fact, I'm surprised that it hadn't happened sooner.  Secret Pizza in Cosmo, Five50 in Aria, New York Pizzeria in New York New York, Pin-Up Pizza...it's almost like folks suddenly realized it could be profitable to sell pizzas by the slice along the Strip.  I mean, it's not like there are a lot of folks out there looking for a (relatively) cheap meal/snack or some post-clubbing/drinking/gambling eats.  But hey, better late than never!  Located on the street level of Planet Hollywood on The Strip, Pin-Up Pizza features the same New York-style slices as the likes of Secret Pizza and New York Pizzeria, but their range of pies is a bit more unique than their competitors'.  Of their seven different offerings (Cheese, Pepperoni, Big Meat, Margherita, Chicken & Spinach, Prosciutto & Arugula, and Pancetta & Mushroom), I opted to get a slice of their CHICKEN & SPINACH ($7) as it looked a bit more appealing than the rest.  After they warmed it up in their oven, the first thing that struck me about my slice was how large it was.  Their menu isn't wrong about how they have big slices - mine was spilling off the plate!  What's more, I really the white sauce underneath all that cheese and how they didn't skimp on the toppings.  The only (slight) bummer for me was the crust.  Not bad by any means, but I wish it was a little softer/chewier and that it had a little more flavor to it.  Otherwise, this was a very solid slice!  Given all of the fast food joints that are within a short walk from Pin-Up Pizza (McDonald's, Popeye's, Panda Express, everything in Miracle Mile, etc.), there are plenty of alternatives for some cheap eats.  However, as far as late night slices go, Pin-Up is a solid choice that's literally on The Strip (doesn't require going into the hotel for) and at a decent price, considering how large the slice is for your money.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Spinach Pizza

cXNU_epytZkCHU2u9WpXkg.text: Came here for a pepperoni slice after some drinks. I was disappointed considering this place has been featured on tv shows with high recommendations. Pizza was soggy and greasy. The cashier was rushing people out. For a great slice go to Secret Pizza!

Btbzczd7IQQCy6Rnqyt02Q.text: There is a reason there is always a line here.  The Margarita pizza is good, but ask for it a well done so the tomatoes cook through.  That said, go for the meat varieties if you are not diet restricted.  The crust has a good chew, and it is a good NY style slice.  This is not the place for extra cheese, or deep dish, so be warned.  The line moves fast, and they finish/re-heat the slices on demand.  My only real complaints are that seating is very limited, and they don't have boxes for take out.  I suggest popping into PH and finding a seat in the closest lounge, rather than standing around outside choking down a slice you should really take your time with.

WwOMAROGxh3BuzAKhY0zTw.text: Not bad not bad. So I'm a huge Chicago deep dish fan, but this New York style from this place is pretty good. I personally just got the cheese pizza slice and it was really good. The crust wasn't burnt, the cheese was good, and I finished the whole thing. My boyfriend got the pepperoni. We thought it was regular but it ended up being spicy pepperoni. Not a huge different but we didn't notice it and had to take a few out. That also made his pizza like really greasy. But overall it was good. The pizza slice is huge so only get one and see if you finish it or not. To me it was kinda easy to finish because I only got cheese and I was also pretty hungry so yeah haha.   So this place is right in front of the miracle shops and when I pass by I always always see a huge line and sometimes out the door. But we went at 10:30pm and there was no line. I thought it was closed. I was so shocked. But like right after we ordered a few more people started coming in and it got busy again. So I guess we just got lucky.  It is a small place so not good for big crowds. It is cramped inside but there is a little balcony area outside to stand up, eat, and people watch so that's not a bad option either.   Would I come here again? If the line is short then yes!

2DOnHd-zGATNpuq-zi9dXA.text: Kept hearing about this pizza place and finally made the time to check it out. I definitely recommend it if your visiting vegas or just want a new place to try for locals. I've been twice now and lines are always pretty long but for the most part they help people fast to get the line moving. Staff was pretty friendly but they are working to move fast the line. The pizza is pretty much basic pizza not to many customizing options but the pizza was very tasty and the slice was just as pictures show. I think that was the excitement the big slices haha but definitely worth it. It's a very small space and they don't have a-lot of seating options so it is more a grab and go place. They have an entrance thats on Las Vegas blvd and thru the casino but seems like they keep the line organized so theres no confusion with people coming in from different sides. Thanks again ,will keep this place in mind next time i find myself on the strip!

PvEd9eAsUQwp1czt3wlPlg.text: Late night food stop before going to bed after a long night at the casino/ bars/ you name it.  I stayed at PH and found this place by accident. Theres always a line but its efficient.  GREAT Choices of pizza and the slices are "HUGE"....  My favorite thing to do now is eat one hot and save one in the hotel fridge for the morning!  Go tos were peperoni, loved the mushroom bacon one, big meat was great, and the white cheese one with spinach and chicken.  YUM!!!  So good, love the spice of the pepperoni, really unique and packs a nice bite.  Great service as well putting up with all those people, many of them intoxicated, give your staff a raise, they have the patience of a bonsai gardener.

SELUUYwBEOd3w4QCPG6zrg.text: Late night pizza. Large enough to share for 2 unless you're really hungry. $7.50 for a slice. We went at 1am and they were out of garlic knots and didn't have to go boxes. When cooked the pizza had a little crisp to the thinner part near the tip and then got thicker towards the crust. Pepperoni had a kick to it. Overall a great quick late night place near Planet Hollywood.

nGY-Xz2HxR5THrAL19kSjg.text: This was the largest slice of pizza I've ever had in my entire life... When we arrived to the area where Pin-Up Pizza was, a girl caught our eye trying to eat a gigantic slice of pizza and we couldn't believe our eyes. As we got closer, we found the source and we knew that we HAD to stop by here.   A lot of the times we stopped by there would be a huge line up that we never wanted to stand in. One late night a friend and I were making a quick Walgreens run. Since we were in the area, we thought to check out to see if there was a line up at Pin-Up Pizza and there wasn't, it was maybe around 1-2am. I ordered a Big Meat slice and my friend got a Panchetta and Mushroom slice. The stand up patio/eating area was also quite empty so we decided to stand and eat our slices there.  The pizzas were thin-crusted and had an evenly flat layer of toppings. It wasn't your normal, tower full of meat pizza, but that's the trade off for such a large slice. A little bit on the saltier side for me, but otherwise delicious. Pretty oily because of all the meat that I had but that was expected. Piping hot because they will reheat your slices for you.   I'd like to try more flavours before giving it a better rating. A great place for a quick, huge snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting excited to eat our Big Meat and Panchetta &amp; Mushroom slices!
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Meat and Panchetta &amp; Mushroom. We had to fold our slices because it was too long on a plate.
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside Pin-up Pizza. It&#39;s a small place but their slices make up for it.

HcVRc_QC9NgU0FFQcqi0Ww.text: The pizza was pretty good and really large, especially for a late night spot. The garlic knots are really what you should be aiming for, theyre soft and flavorful and really worth it. I got the combo for $9-10 which is just the right amount for one person and relatively cheap considering the area. The service is quick and awesome here, try it!

c9uY6IA0lE2nVNN26Dma5w.text: I was traveling with my brother and we wanted to try Pizza. When I got inside the pizza place, I notice how huge the pizza looks. We got the Chicken and Spinach topping one. My first bite of that pizza was that it was full of cheesy flavor. The crunch, the chicken, and the spinach was just right and it just really melts together into your mouth. It was like some pizza ecstasy or something. Take another bite and your like I can't stop eating this. Now folks, this is how good pizza suppose to be like. Every bite make you want more and more until you have nothing left. Then reality hits you. The pizza you have in your hand went right into your stomach, but that experience will linger onto your mind.

iD2szl7bpjWKyaA0OGhTFA.text: This place was awesome! You walk in and see beautiful tattooed women and wooly mammoth sized pizzas!!!!! They are delicious!!!! I got the spinach chicken and the crust was crunchy, amazing!!!!!! They have a small area inside to stand and eat or a small outside area to stand and eat

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These pizzas are massive!!
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and chicken
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to get one to go!

OxhwnxRjaJHjji18uMWVoQ.text: If you're near Planet Hollywood and looking for cheap and delicious pizza, go to Pin Up Pizza. It is located inside Planet Hollywood but can seen by the strip, behind Ringers restaurant which is across from Earl of Sandwich. It is a small shop with stand up tables with a nice view of the strip. If you are just ordering slices (not combos), you can eat inside Ringers.   The pizza is very good and a great deal for being on the strip. Each slice is huge! They are 15" long. I tried the Margherita pizza and it was very delicious! The tomatoes are seasoned well and go well with the mozzarella. The Sandra Dee combo is the way to go!! You get any slice of pizza, a garlic knot (YUUUUM), and drink, all for $9.50. Try it out if you're close by!

o1wWKlPGLYUeLRVcWmcDjw.text: Put their slices in the oven to heat it, still manages to be cold by the time I pay. Being as cold pizza is a good measure of how good someone's pizza is, this isn't spectacular by any means.  Just underwhelming for me. Secret Pizza in the cosmopolitan was much better.

T4BA4datzxk-DoE30aImSw.text: We happened upon Pin Up Pizza last Monday night while roaming around the strip...and after having a very late lunch and a liquid dinner...we thought maybe a slice or two of pizza would hit the spot.  We walked in to the super convenient location right next to Planet Hollywood Hotel/Casino and when we saw the slices, decided to split one between us.  We ordered a straight up cheese slice and wow...sooo tasty!!  We've had the best of the best in NYC and I have to say that this pizza held its ground with some of the better non-NY slices around, including that "super secret" pizza place over at the Cosmopolitan (they get a bonus for the video games though haha)  Wish we would have read some reviews and ordered a garlic knot, but hey, now we'll have to go back again during our next Vegas visit!  Overall I'd highly recommend this establishment.  Grab a (huge) slice, hang outside and do some people watching.

bvr1Nl_WcLLoZw_dgFqbyg.text: Great spot to grab a snack or dinner.  I was in the mood for a slice and I'm glad I stopped here!  Staff was friendly and the pizza was outstanding.  The slices are huge, so make sure you got some room!  Would definitely go back

oTj5-iRSfT45O-FWWqeI7g.text: My least favorite of the 3 pizza joints I tried in Vegas late-night. It wasn't bad. It was okay. The garlic knots were super soft...just no garlic or olive oil goodness like you get up north. So I was disappointed.

VoBYX1Q6mk4RjBgunROE_g.text: Pin-Up pizza is the best pizza I've ever had. The first time I came to Vegas, we stopped in, I thought it was too good to be True, came back out to Vegas two weeks ago, first stop was pin-up and it was as consistent as the first time. Had a couple of my boys with me, they agreed much better than other pizza they've had. I strongly recommend making a stop at Pin-up, if not, your not getting your full Vegas experience. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BIG MEAT

c4I3UMMYuqTzSuvAGtPe5A.text: Such a good deal for the price you pay.. especially when it comes to eating on the stripe which can be a little pricey. I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza along with the garlic knot and a beer. Outstanding prices and outstanding food! Definitely will be back again. The garlic knot is amazing!!

XCIAHSUt-jVR71eHdCMz1g.text: Great pizza and wings, great staff and best value in the area and its on the strip .. not buried in a lavish hotel or casino.  Stephanie was awesome and she and the cook took good care of us. Great place to grab a quick bite during the day or late at night after going out. The combo is best deal. The pizza is good too very aromatic and flavorful, crisp crust nut not too crisp to where it hurts the roof of your mouth. Killer chow. Thanks again guys.

VzGqmiJ-DahpBiFQvPlxlw.text: Not a huge fan, I personally love pizza!! But idk what it was I just wasn't a huge fan of the pizza.

zNmBUJ6kQhdRZSUTa2URKA.text: Around $12 for a huge slice of pizza, garlic knot, and a beer! Service was quick and food was pretty tasty.  One slice is enough for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XztHAw2zay6yji0IijvVKw.text: Usually the best pizza experiences happen after you've just left a club and had too much to drink. However, we came here on a Friday, sober, to grab pizza and beer.    The pizza was delicious! Pick the slice you want abs they will warm it up for you!!!

aQ4Lai8pVRrHMEWkTurFhw.text: I came here with a friend after 1 am or so, and I really enjoyed the experience. This is a really cute outlet on the Las Vegas strip right by Planet Hollywood. The pizzas are huge which means that the slices are also just as big! I couldn't even finish my slice but, I devoured it when I got back home because it was absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How big my pizza slice was compared to me.

Aj4iD3d_sfN5Ar7BryeYLw.text: This pizza by the slice place has a hidden entrance from the casino but visible from the street. It is great for grab and go but there is a small bar type standing to eat and get a view of the strip. One slice is more than enough for adult and kids can split a slice. The service was excellent with a lot of patience with kids. We had four with us

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My vege and chicken
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That is a 9inch dinner plate
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

veKNp85IzOSFqbN8yi0SnA.text: I love the margarita pizza & always ask for extra heirloom tomatoes. I live in Vegas & only allow myself to eat here if I walk here bc the slices are so big!! The garlic knots are to die!! They give plenty of toppings too! Garlic salt, sriachia, green Tabasco, parm cheese etc!!! Only compliant is it gets super crowded. Not enough room to stand

adBGPAonOYRt0PhCBSOmYQ.text: Pizza is very large and filling. But to me, very salty. But It was good. Just a little in the salty side where I had to drink water with it. Line was long on a late night but it was fast moving.  Fast was very friendly so I can not complain at all. I walked from Bally's and bought two slices but they didn't have any pizza boxes or bags for me to carry them securely in. Just a plate covering the pizza up.  Overall. A late night delight for Las Vegas gluttony.

zbihn0pA5MhMmUO3lOV01w.text: I think this place is unique in the fact that the pizza is so oversized. However, taste wise, I don't think it was anything earth shattering. It is good, if you need a quick bite to eat or are in a hurry. Other than that, unless you want a novelty slice of pizza, I would go somewhere else.  There is no seating, so you either can eat at the standing counter, which is usually packed, or outside.   There is a decent selection of toppings, but the taste is mediocre. It wasn't anything I was raving about when I came home.    Also I was kind of confused with the name of the shop. Since, it is called pin up pizza, it is decorated in past pin up girls. However, I do not think the way the shop is set up as grab and go pizza that the theme makes much sense. Before we ate here I thought it was a pizza place where the waitresses were dressed up as pinup girls. Since it is Vegas, I was expecting over the top. Instead it is just a quick stop decorated in pinups of the past.

7UpaDonPNIGXlWOFfEyUHw.text: This place was awesome, I had two slices from here the plain slice and then the prosciutto slice which was amazing! After a long day of drinking and betting at the sports book this was a great night cap after hitting a 3 team parlay in sin city!

45ZcmPZ1a8MumvzPCSHpCQ.text: Whaaaa? This pizza is damn good. Huge slices of all different varieties. Pick one, they heat it up and you push it into your face and burn your mouth. Ok, wait, blow on it, try again!  Ahhhh, that's better and wow are the flavors good. The slices are NY style, thin and crispy. It's open late and  has a great outdoor seating area. I want a piece right now!

8sAenz1dnIekK6IGiUR0qQ.text: This place is awesome- big slices - tastes great- perfect for your stumble back to your hotel

yZ0rVf2d99qX1t8_DrKgxA.text: Decent pizza that makes up for quality with quantity. You need to eat the pizza here with a fork and a knife... or find a way to finesse a bite without the pizza falling apart. They're huge, but a huge part of it is a massive crust. Pro tip: season your pizza by getting drunk during the evening. It helps the pizza taste a little better. The margherita pizza was the best and that's coming from someone who likes pepperoni and sausage.  So why the one star? The service.  One morning before heading out to the river, my girlfriend went up to the counter to ask when they would open. There were 3 guys behind the counter, each facing the glass, heads down. My girlfriend said excuse me three times. Not once did anyone acknowledge her. I was standing about 6-7 feet away and I could hear her clearly.  Another example of poor service was when I got back one night from the river. I stood in line underneath the "order here" sign. The guy making pizza was doing his own thing. Then another guy came out to work on other orders. No one said a word. Other people began to wonder where to order. At that moment, someone walked up to the register and began ordering, even though other people, including myself were waiting at the "order here" sign first. I asked where we should order and finally they said I would be next.  The hours of operation on yelp are also incorrect. I believe they close at 10 PM as of July 2017. Anyway, the poor service seems to be a common topic amongst customers. I was able to experience it myself.

xyBr5XqHLnlkbotj1hni8w.text: The pizza was ok, nothing really special about it beside it being as large as your face. Very plain. Pizza dough, sauce, cheese, pepperoni. They ask you for your selection then they warm it up for you in the oven. Very friendly staff. Cool to see the chef kneading the dough and making the pizza right there behind the glass. Kind of on the pricey side for one slice ($7) I went because I saw a video on Facebook and it was conveniently located in the same building as my hotel. They have a standing section that you can set your pizza down at and stand and eat. Good stop for a quick bite to eat after the bars. They close at 4 am.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mViWdcqkylbztS90la611g.text: Hit the spot! Wanted pizza quick and not spend a zillion dollars. We grabbed this after a long day. Not certain it's okay that everyone does it but we got pizza and went in to the sports bar connected by a hallway to have their drinks with it. It was yummy and for only $6-7 a slice... it's a yummy deal.

3TiHgKcRPoaQCT1xuoRwyQ.text: Personally, I don't believe there is such a thing as bad pizza. So I probably wouldn't give any pizza place a bad review. I came to pin up because of the videos I had seen on Facebook.. Yes, the slices are big. But they're nothing to write home about.  I really wanted to try the garlic knots but they had run out. Also the line and wait times were pretty long for pretty normal pizza. I would save my time and just go somewhere else.

2HLdd318Fi8gFdfPh31FpA.text: I saw this place on the insider goods on my FB and got very excited. Let me tell you that it's just OK. Yes the slices are huge, but the taste, not so much. Waited in lime for 30 minutes and the o my thing that really had me in "awe" were their garlic knots! So delicious. Had the pepperoni pizza and meat lovers. Was just ok. Was disappoint to see that it was just reheated in the over pizza. When I saw that, I knew it wouldn't be much. I was right. This is a spot where you can say u ate it, but won't go out of your way to come again.

D5Aes3dfvtAbP6tPGUptUg.text: I've been stopping by this pizza place each time I visit Vegas for the last few years now. It's way better than Secret Pizza (inside the Cosmopolitan). The slice on its own is big enough to share, but I don't share food...and I ate the whole slice by myself (always do). A slice on its own is about $7, I would totally recommend the combo if you have a big appetite because it comes with a soda/beer and a garlic knot which is just as amazing at the pizza. There's a counter inside and outside of the place where you can enjoy your pizza with cheese, chili flakes, and hot sauces on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1XqJnpnWK6aJUjYAmCHWFw.text: Sorry, I prefer Secret Pizza. I like how Pin Up has some more unique pies available without requiring a special order (chicken and spinach, potato-prosciutto-mushroom), and the slices are huge enough to feed two, and make a cheap Strip meal... but the product itself just isn't something I'd come back for. Pizza slice didn't have much flavor in the toppings or crust, maybe I'd have better luck sticking to the classic pepperoni?   I also disliked that the base of the pie was covered in tons of little crumbs that looked like pepper(?) and made a huge mess on my hands as I ate. Grab napkins if you take your order to go. Counter staff were dressed in keeping with the pin up theme, but the cold, unfriendly attitude was something I could do without.   TIP:  I think the only way to get to it is from the exterior along the Strip. Get here from Planet Hollywood parking garage by taking the Miracle Mile shops to the right, follow signage to exit for the Strip, and take an immediate right.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom prosciutto potato

BAqsZQascC_k2Ztc63rOAw.text: If size is the only thing that matters, than you will be satisfied by Pin Up Pizza. No one will be able to eat an entire pie by themselves. Lol  10 slices in the pie will run you $75. If you must take it home, be warned, you will need the entire trunk/cargo section to fit the pizza. After getting over the size factor, the taste was okay. I've had better New York style pizzas and better pizzas in general. We had the pepperoni. The sauce was bland and the cheese was barely noticeable. The service was nice enough and you get to see them make the pizza, but taste is what ultimately matters. If you are looking for better tasting pizza along the strip, I would suggest avoiding this place. Taste not size is what matters.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M7h5Y641jRK4PW-eyMqsiA.text: My friends and I visited Vegas and we arrived kind of late. Luckily this place is open until 4 am. My friend and I got some slices for a group of us and took it to go. We ordered just a slice for each of us because they were pretty huge. We got two chicken and spinach and two big meat slices and they were sooo good. We wanted to try the garlic knots too but they were all out when we got there. I usually go to another pizza place when I'm in Vegas but this place is pretty good too! If you are ever around Planet Hollywood, you should grab some pizza from here!

TKUGFUvxXtarwoS3hv37vg.text: Great pizza! The location is easy to find and they were really fast. The only reason they don't get a 5 is because it's great pizza, but not the best pizza.

nWbsvgKyTwkqjEU2vkGa-g.text: Bomb Gigantor-Sized Pizza! Best pizza on the strip at the right price.

WSXP23nf22zWTb_zmFDLSw.text: The pizza was very good as was the garlic knot, the service was absolutely horrible though. We went right after it opened today and the lady working had no personality. Very unfortunate as it seemed like we were bothering her.

huIwOyDosR7gi9EVAgc_OA.text: This place make a really great slice of pizza.  The pepperoni is my favorite. I have been here several times late at night after being out and about and they have never let me down.

c5C3tQmfO-kSOF4xw9PwrA.text: I went to this place because of the pizza size promotion. The size is big as advertised but the taste of it completely ruined my experience due to an extreme salty tasted. I can't stop drinking water and soda while eating and afterward.

q0VBGt0XvzEgmdLBH_zEdA.text: This is great pizza after a night of drinking on the strip, probably not so much without the beer goggles. The Margherita pizza was fresh with a good mix of tomatoes, but would have benefitted from more basil.   Slices are huge and cheap, perfect for late night grazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8sveRBFKuBxO3N7WpAa-mQ.text: The pancetta and mushroom and margherita pizza are TO DIE FOR. They use real pancetta and I believe portobello which makes for a tasty thing for the first one. And the margherita uses colorful cherry tomatoes and actual mozzarella sprinkled with herbs. They're both just so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Both so good!

2Jpl9c7O0bUrXwLlOGwatw.text: The pizza is just ok, the novelty of the huge slice is what gets you. We also ordered fried pickles and cheese fries both are very good, plenty of cheese on the fries and the pickles are flavorful. Service was soso, the waitress kept telling me she just came on shift as an explanation of the dirty table.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xL0uNOFdkFaW-PS1PPvX7g.text: I love the margarita Pizza it's so good! I absolutely love it it's super big ! I had to share it with my boyfriend and also it's super affordable! Too bad I live all the way in San Francisco but next time I come and visit I will definitely come again

vqzkvoKQgomud8C1uTLiuw.text: My friend and I visited Vegas back in February 2019. And before we got ready to hit the clubs we wanted to get a quick bite to eat. We heard about this place through a couple of mutual friends and we decided to give it a try. Located near Planet Hollywood this restaurant offers giant slices of pizza!   I ordered the pepperoni and sausage pizza. Which with a combo included a drink and garlic bread. The crust on the pizza is thin (my favorite kind of crust) and each bite had the perfect amount of cheese and toppings. The only downside to this place it that they don't really have a large enough seating area so be prepared to stand and eat if you choose to stay there.   Other than that a solid 4/5 stars definitely get your money's worth and hunger satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni and Sausage Pizza

QyNtBVs6n5wqIqa-jCNSNg.text: Pizza was not as big as I was expecting. Most of all, super oily (I suppose that's good for drunk peeps) and not much meat.   The business hours is deceiving. Many groups of people came around 3:20AM but they closed the door to public at around 3AM when their hours clearly state open until 4AM.   Servers are rude.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GtGdiF0hXD1FoSMKmJTivg.text: I'm in Vegas for the Usual Suspect Gathering version 11 !!!! I'm floating around at 3AM and have a Gangster Buzz On And I'm Craving Pizza !!!  What's up Homie!!!  Pin Up Pizza  that's what's up Homie!!!  I approach the Fast Growing line and there's all kinds of Characters in line . I'm actually amused!!! Lots of Drunk Ladies in Skimpy Outfits and drunk groups of Men trying to Holler!!!!  I'm patiently waiting in line and  I'm amused at the Awesome  cashier working the Front Counter!!! She's Tall Dark and Gorgeous!!! She also has a Razor Sharp Witt and assigns every customer a Knick Name while Masterfully taking their Orders!!!  Outstanding!!!! She's a Gem !!!  I ordered an All Meat Slice and She expresses her Amusement in a Light and Flirty Way!!!   She delivers my all Meat Slice in 7 Minutes flat with a smile!!!  The Slice is Definitely BIG and amazingly well constructed and is of the Thin Crust Variety!!  It's pretty tasty and crispy!!! I choose to eat my Slice on the Strip and watch the Freak Show we call Las Vegas!!!!

St0b0vUgy_zaOADT0dmefw.text: You have to definitely try this larger than life pizza shop right off of Las Vegas Blvd. Right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle is this small little pizza workshop, where you can find a line outside the door. The slices are definitely larger than life even bigger than the plate that they serve it on. One slice was more than enough for at least two people, plus their garlic knots are just out of this world. The garlic knots almost resemble a cinnamon roll.  We tried the pepperoni pizza and the chicken and spinach flavored pizzas tonight. The pepperoni was pretty simple but yet flavorful with a little bit of garlic sprinkled on top. The chicken and spinach was probably my favorite filled with chunks of grilled chicken and spinach spread throughout the pizza and a sprinkling of garlic powder as well. You could buy sauces on the side as well as the garlic knots, but we did not venture that far this evening. This place is definitely a must try while on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and spinach along with pepperoni pizza
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5r7D37Au4LRESlJU0b6BVA.text: This pizza spot is located near Planet Hollywood and they offer giant slices of pizza! I ordered the spinach and chicken pizza and the boyfriend ordered the sausage pizza. The crust on the pizza is thin with the perfect amount of cheese and toppings. Decent pricing for a slice of pizza. We both ordered ours to go and the box itself was unique. One individual pizza slice box for your pizza slice to go! (Too cute!) Be prepared to stand and eat if you do decide to eat here because this place does not offer a seating area.   I'm pretty sure this place gets very busy at night, especially after a night of clubbing or drinking. Luckily, my boyfriend and I visited this place during lunchtime and there was hardly anyone there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottom left: spinach and chicken  Top right: sausage pizza

m8ZXNOyXGaFbAgqHZk_2Og.text: Basic tasting pizza, but colossal slices!   Prices are reasonable, and the combos are an even better deal. The pizza had been sitting out for awhile and that's exactly what it tasted like. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad; just tasted similar to Costco's pizza.   We came in mid-afternoon and it wasn't busy yet (thankfully!) This spot tends to get heavy foot traffic at night when most places are closed; so it is a plus that it's open until 4am!   Hope to try the cannoli and garlic knots next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic knots
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli

cg_3KV-weOUMrVuVa1V7PA.text: Pin-up pizza popped up on a Facebook post, so we decided to try it out for dinner...  Walking on the strip trying to find PinUp was difficult. Seriously, if you blink, you'll miss it (which we did) it's in a construction area, and it's really small. There are 2 standing tables outside, and a standing counter inside. It was pretty crowded with day drinkers, and we had our whole clan with us. We sat our 6yr old on the counter so he didn't get trampled.   We chose the big meat, 2 cheese, pepperoni, and a chicken and spinach. Yes, the slices are HUGE! The pizzas in the window are the biggest I've seen in my life.. But they were just alright. I did enjoy the sweetness of the crust - it was soft and doughy. Like freshly baked bread. I think I was looking for explosive flavor - more grease, more sauce, more everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think this was the Margherita
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginormous pizzas
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; spinach, big meat &amp; pepperoni on the standing counter

0RQLUIOsKGojxXl1cuBE1A.text: THE spot to go to for a slice of pizza! The portions are huge I was eating that thing for a good 30 minutes it seemed lol. The prices are great and it's right off the main strip for convenience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big pizza
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizzaaa

9TPpIOjGxIe89hy5PFxdrw.text: If you've been out partying, seeing a show or simply checking out the Vegas strip, this is a great place to stop for a quick pizza slice! A "quick stop, pizza spot" decorated with pin up pictures of female celebrities. Offering a variety of choices for pizza slices, garlic knots, desserts like Cannolis.    Indoor and outdoor dining bars and a few tables.  They have combo deals like  The Sandra Dee - a slice of pizza, garlic knot and beverage.   You can dine there and take in the sights and sounds of the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sandra D combo
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xm0fvI90CjgkLRw0AgoPmA.text: Pin-Up Pizza is probably one of the best cheap food spots on the strip.   You pick your slice when it is your turn, and the employee warms it up in the oven.   We got the margarita and it was SOOOO GOOD. The slice was pretty big, we got full off of it.   Price was around $7.50  Cons: No chairs, the cheese and peppers were not filled up when we went.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2h_lISXHhvMLxEhICKi2iQ.text: Called "Pin-up pizza" because apparently the girls who work here are supposed to be "pin-ups" (aka calendar girls dressed like you can pin them up lol - I don't think this tradition is True anymore though, so that's good).  Pros: - located right on the strip - came here right after seeing Backstreet Boys at Zappos at Planet Hollywood, very convenient location - good grab & go vibes - the service is usually pretty quick, the to-go boxes are strong - decently priced for a pizza slice the size of your arm (see pic) - standing-only counter space right outside to use if you're starving - just keep in mind it's not really a sit-down restaurant kind of vibe - open late, typical drunk food/munchie vibes  Cons: - line can get pretty long depending on time of day - just average pizza (tbh though i'll probably still keep coming here lol)

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uNtqoL67EWdZ2pXxIhyLWA.text: Excellent pizza place. Always busy so you know it's legit. Nice ambiance with gorgeous photos of celebrities in their best pin up attire. Line goes quickly and even if it's a bit of a wait, trust me. It's worth it. We went twice during our last Vegas trip. Best late night food, drunk food, really great pizza in general. And did I mention the slices are huuuge?   I ordered the combo with a pizza slice, garlic knot & drink. The garlic knot is pre-made then goes into the oven to get golden and the butter melts all over. The knot itself is soft and full of parmesan and garlic flavors.   I got a margherita pizza slice and holy crap! Amazingly juicy cherry tomatoes, the fresh mozzarella is ooey-gooey amazing and I think there's some balsamic adding a lil punch of acidity to the bites. Crust is thin and crispy on the bottom. Ugh. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken&amp; spinach pizza. Yum!
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic knot and margherita pizza

oZbhSXUud51q_W9unnEWCQ.text: Pretty average pizza right on the strip.  Nice place to grab something quick however.  The three star rating is for the workers here who were great when I stopped.  They were fun, personable, and entertaining.  It was almost like watching a show while waiting for things.    The lines can get long during busy hours so be aware.  Also, they do not have to go boxes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vdLxcwqxTaLCeAyHOIVffA.text: I saw the ad got this place on Facebook. This place was very disappointing. The pizza was not that big. The taste was more like cardboard and grease. The cashier was friendly. The price was affordable. I think it is one of the most affordable places on the strip, but I doesn't matter because it's disgusting. Don't go!!! Go anywhere else. There is a food court nearby. Go there. So disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A slice

q6bpKqmb6UCl-5p-ynnZLQ.text: If in Vegas and want a huge slice of Pizza this is your place. It is on the strip and extremely affordable. The pizza selection is pretty good and you can also have a beer. The staff was extremely nice and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QaT-q8fxuA5yxOBf-BXtyQ.text: I gave two stars because overall I wasn't satisfied. The customer service could have been way better. I didn't feel welcomed. The atmosphere was definitely off. Second. The cold pizza was put in the oven and taken out so fast that by the time I blinked , it became cold again. The taste didn't make it much better either. . And it also wasn't as big as advertised with peoples arms. . . Not sure if it's because I'm from New York and we have better pizza but this was definitely a disappointment.. the garlic knot was good tho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One cold pepperoni pizza

8y1Gql5oJfcHq24TR9vljQ.text: My friend LOVES this place. So I tried it while I'm Vegas and slices are bigger than your face for about $7 the combo is about $12/13 comes with a garlic knot and drink.  I got the combo with meat lovers slice and it was pretty good! Not the best I've had but it was good, Those knots are delicious. I also ordered the cannoli which I didn't like, it had pieces of oranges in it giving it a citrusy flavor which isn't something I like in a cannoli.   It's not a sit down restaurant, more of a Grab and go place. They do have counters inside but it gets busy at certain times so it wouldn't be the most comfortable place to eat, better off eating outside or in the connected sports bar.  I would come again for the filling meal and those garlic knots!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hYCyq9fkdsPILqos7FdfBw.text: My friend highly recommended Pin-Up Pizza so I decided to check this place out. WOOOOOOW were the pizza slices HUGE!! The price was super reasonable for the size of the slice you get. Definitely one of the best cheap food spots on the strip! I also love that they make the bottom of the pizza crispy. So sooo good. Definitely something different than how I'm use to having it. Will definitely be back!

cNpUirpOLr1DHz5HM9EgKA.text: The location is perfect for a pizzeria since it is located right on the strip & right outside where many tourists/guests walk by everyday. The pizza itself is good a little too greasy for my taste but nothing a couple napkins can't fix & a dash of pepper. The size is bigger then most slices which is nice. Expect a line & to wait a bit if visiting!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese pizza
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

W6C_2iW8zqh-1nffngyCng.text: I DID IT FOR THE GRAM  ok so I totally got sucked in to going to this place after I saw a story on Facebook about this pizza place in Vegas that sells HUGE pizza slices. But boy was I disappointed and so were my FOUR KIDS that I dragged to get it! They walked a mile (a mile as you know is equivalent to 15 to a 7 year old) in 100 degree heat from our hotel for this pizza that I hyped up the whole time driving here from LA only to find that there is NO SEATING and PARMESAN CHEESE packets. WTH?! The video that I saw on Facebook totally showed a woman sitting and eating her pizza!!! Anyway, pizza is OK at best...we got the normal pepperoni and cheese pizza and honestly, taste wise there's better pizza out there...price is fair though!

Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No seating!!
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small shop with no seating...

Jx62Dujqp4aPUU5cKPeVmA.text: My girlfriend and I were extremely disappointed in the quality of the pizza. All we wanted was a slice of pizza, and what we got was overly salty bread with little ingredients. The biggest disappointment was the menu listed on yelp is outdated by two years! They lacked veggie options, and their margarita pizza was just tomatoes (although heirloom cherry tomatoes were used) and sliced mozzarella with no tomato sauce leaving areas of the pie with no ingredients- and on a large slice it's a lot of empty space. The pizza was so salty we couldn't even finish our slices and we needed to drink lots of water after. Even writing this review after the facts my tongue and lips are tingling just due to the amount of salt used. I would never recommend this place and if someone wanted a slice I would recommend Sbarro inside of Planet Hollywood.

IgocSVWorRcH0EXCJkB9mQ.text: Pizza is just ok.  Slices are big and it's convenient.  But no where to sit and only average food.

pUO2DdNhK8jPGbmpHdNHVQ.text: Their pizzas are really good here! I've had the margherita and pancetta/potato pizza.  The crust is very crispy.  I like that they finish cooking the pizza right when you order it.  It's fast pizza that's super big and hot when you get it.  I've tried the more popular one across the street, but I prefer this one.  They're both hot and crispy, but this one is bigger and you get more flavor choices.

WaO2lHKVOlvuVk2rIsd36w.text: The spot is connected to the Planet Hollywood sportsbook enough said! Heavy drinking is next door and the crowd comes with it! We stopped in here to soak up some of the liquor after serious night of drinking. We met some Canadians at the tables and sponsored the pizza which made that pizza incredible! Yelp help the experience because they offered free beer with a check in!

vWSiaX8i3ka2DvqmNITaMQ.text: HUGE and DELICOUS slices at very REASONABLE PRICES.  I went back the very next day.  Only downside is they don't have inside seating, although you can easily slip into the Sports Book for Planet Hollywood Casino and find a place to sit..  Margherita Pizza was my favorite.  Staff was friendly.  They apologized for my slice taking a little extra time.  I didn't even notice and thought it was delivered quickly.  Will definitely go back!

MEaaMQv5ULiEofqQPJUFxg.text: The pizza here is high quality food and the slices are like 2x the size of Costco and for a great price too!...really recommend it

_VDxMykDDt1fpis0f5EfUg.text: Food is terrible pizza is dry... Warmed up a pre cooked slice of pizza... Meat was soggy on the all meat pizza.. No where to sit you have to stand and eat.. Super cramped small place... Didn't enjoy my food I don't recommend this place to eat

BIRBcB9PgXwpjALr-L7J_Q.text: Thanks to the friendly Canadian that we met at the casino, this meal was free-ninety-nine... Otherwise, I probably would've had to chop off a 1/2 star or so. The pizza did what it was supposed to do after a night of drinking but was less-than-average and definitely could've used more cheese. We did appreciate the Yelp offer for the free beer - again, another reason for the rating. Other than that, there are better late night pizza spots on the strip.

7VpF5bqCuyK5ddZTKMzOeg.text: if i could leave zero stars i would!   1. pizza was pulled out early and was cold  2.cold pizza was left out in front of other customers to breath on  3.cashier lady was rude as hell and had a problem when i asked for no ice! was it that bad?!  4. overpriced   take your business elsewhere, people!

5Jz9AxCmLKMeG0dDiDh_iw.text: Pizza looks amazing..... but what I really got was bad customer service, cold pizza, cold bread knot, and ice water that cost me $1.50  IMO secret pizza is better

1l_Hen4TJOjkHI0gJHPODA.text: I have been to Pin Up Pizza a few times now, and I love it. It's excellent.   A slice of pepperoni is $6.75, and it's worth every penny. The slices are fresh, and they're heated in the oven while you pay, so they're always hot. Lots of flavor. They're huge slices. You're really getting double the slice of a chain slice for the same price. For the price, compared to other eateries in Vegas, it's a really good deal. A combo deal with a garlic knot and a soda is about $10 plus tax, and a couple bucks more if you want a beer. Wait times are minimal and the service is excellent. Be prepared though. It's small inside and draws a large crowd, and the staff takes many orders at once. Please be considerate, pay attention when called on, keep the line moving smoothly, and tip the staff as you leave. They do a great job.   The space to dine in or outside on the strip is very limited. No chairs. There is a little more room outside, where I like to eat. You can people watch as you eat, which is always fun and entertaining. But if you have a large group of people, you might be better served to get your pizza to go. If one person is paying, you may want to have that person go inside while the rest of the group waits outside.   Pro tip: Total Rewards credits are accepted here, so if you're gambling at a Caesar's property, you can use your comps here with no hassles.   If you're looking for an excellent, quality slice of pizza and/or want a quick snack while on the strip, Pin Up Pizza is highly recommended. I just moved here a few weeks ago and imagine I'll be eating here quite often. You won't be disappointed.

mDXZOB2zE6bDx9lUixux9g.text: Had a slice of pizza, soda, and garlic bun here for 9 dollars. Not the best food in Vegas but when your hungry it's great for the price and definitely a huge portion of food. Check it out when you need some quick but decent food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big slice of awesome

Jbp7f_YTUqD5EZlymLZBWw.text: Perfect place to get a late night slice of salt topped with cheese and pepperoni   Disgustingly salty - couldn't eat more than two bites..

m9l_FDHHWISbLpscqb2E1w.text: I had 2 slices plain cheese pizza. Very good. Not the best I've had but very good. Slices are huge as is the whole pie. Just guessing 20-22" Crust was crisp on bottom (as it should be) and even though the slices are large it did not sag. Sauce had a nice flavor and the cheese had just the right amount of sheen. Meaning not that orange greasy stuff flowing from some pizza I've eaten. The garlic knots looked good but with the size of the slices I dared not try them. At least for now. If I am in Las Vegas again I will stop by to try some of their other offerings. Note:White pizza looked phenomenal. Posting a few photos

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice of plain cheese

pkCu0fz9yczivxq3nfU-yA.text: I've been to Vegas three times and this was my first time ever finding this pizza spot. It's located in between restaurants so i know why I missed it so many times. This pizza is sooooo delicious to me, i had it about three times in the week I was out there. Huge Slices for the price they were at.

PCA5yeOYgsAClJn5OkzfMA.text: Wow. I'm here in Sin City too much (working) and even though there are great restaurants it's hard to find a fast and tasty spot. Pin Up Pizza is delicious, fast, convenient, and a good value. While Secret Pizza (Cosmo) and Pop Up (MGM) are good this place is a solid 1 star above.  One slice will easily satisfy you for lunch or a quick dinner. Entrance off the strip or from the PH sports book. Do yourself a favor and stop by next time your in town, this place will definitely steal some of the Earl of Sandwich crowd (and that is very hard to do).

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oQd5JVr2hpr1rj-Hh071lA.text: Pizza was ok but the service was awful. The person behind me asked it they could cut the piece in two and they said no they are too busy. I bought a garlic knot along with my pizza and wanted to buy the extra sauce that is on the menu for .75 to dip my knot in. The lady told me that they are out of sauce. I said I have sauce on my pizza but she said they don't have any. I told her I did not want the knot and she said they already made it and it's good without the sauce. I have had better pizza at every pizza place i have eaten in vegas. Also if you want to sit down to eat don't go here.

4t0C0rAtiMZ43KlN0tUWGQ.text: Really good pie. Would eat here anytime. Had the margherita pizza slice. Having thus slice I wanted more. And they had Rootbeer on the fountain. Not easy to find. After eating my slice, I didn't get that bloated feeling from the crust.

qqA_hCzfbyL6if8D6424cA.text: Coming from the new haven ct area I can say this pizza (and garlic knot) are delicious. Huge slices and nice and thin and crispy. Definitely recommend for a good slice in Vegas!

mszj4jBaxU4tOtescrP2tw.text: Pretty disappointed.. I saw that they had 4 stars & we walked pretty far to get here for this? One reason I chose it was because they sell by the slice & since I can be indecisive I like to get 2 different slices, so.. 1) they didn't have much variety at all 2) not many specialty pieces- very basic 3) the margerita shouldn't even be called margerita, they made it their own way with grape tomatoes, no basil, no tomato sauce 4) my husband got a sausage, ricotta piece & there was so little ricotta  I highly recommend the pizza place in the New York hotel, the one on the second floor..or 800 degrees! Both delicious!!

2SE26inU4PDoE71RFTJISg.text: Love, love, love this place!  The nachos & drinks were SO good. I am definitely eating here again when I come back to Vegas!

vwl_sTWOH6WaaOsc4X_0OQ.text: Pizza was good. The slices are large and come from a   30" pizza.  This place is open til 4am while most places are close. Great for the person with a case if the munchies. They only got stand up areas with counters. Look forward to eating here agian if the opportunity presents itself.

nGZk5alYA206WkA9_d6ckw.text: This pizza spot right here is the truth. I love pizza and Pin Up did not disappoint. Small place with some inside standing and outside standing as well. The slices were fresh and hot, BIG and foldable which is key.  Great spot to grab a slice and a drink for a quick lunch or that in between to soak up the liquor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pin-Up Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big ass slice of Pepperoni......

aZn3zx-YDK9m8FIZR8Mi6w.text: Pizza is the bomb! Located by PH, slices are huge and open late! I'm not even a thin pizza eaten kinda girl, sooooo yeah!

SuMjIndp5lqIM4uHlriESg.text: This review is kind of all over the place, but this is pretty much exactly what happened.  I went to this pizza establishment around 3am August 14, 2016. I went with about 8 people including myself. There were only about 10 people ahead of us when we got there.  I waited in line with about 5 of my friends in front of me.  I get to the register and I state that I wanted to order a slice of cheese and one garlic knot. The girl at the cash register states to me that I have to wait in line before I order... What!? I waited in line for like 5 minutes. She said that I wasn't in line.  After I tell her that I waited in line just like everyone else, she says that I was supposed to put in my order with the other guy. There is a guy cooking the pizzas and pulling them out of the oven. I guess he goes down the line and asks what people want to order.   Well he states that he never saw me in line. I laughed! I am 6'4" and you didn't see me? Come on now. I was literally the biggest person in there...LITERALLY!  After I said that, the girl told me that she would give me what I wanted to order for free. I turned it down...really didn't want a slice of pizza that I'm pretty sure would of gotten spit on.  The guy behind the counter gets mad because I said one cuss word in there. I apologized for saying it..but then he gets loud and says "I have the right to refuse service to you!!!"    I laughed and yelled back to him..."DOG! You already refused service to me..what's next!?"   The girl behind laughed and said, "touche, touche..."

fwhkb7Cn7-Lw_vz5_U8aYQ.text: We saw the line at Earl's Sandwich and was shocked on how long it was going to take, so we decided to walk around. Right outside Planet Hollywood we found this hidden gem and decided to try it out. This is probably one of the best pizzas I have ever had since Village Pizzeria! We ordered one pepperoni and one cheese... then after walking around Planet Hollywood, we went back and got another slice! It's really that good and fairly cheap. Also another plus was that there was no wait!

0uLWSXz0tUkFx8DpouZJuQ.text: the garlic knots are off the hook, so fresh and light...perfect amount of garlic and butter...a must try

qWFTqzTxCCV4UCwOoia3Rw.text: Meh.  With their hours, they're obviously aiming partly at the late night inebriated post-club crowd, probably to compete partly with Secret Pizza.  While these slices may be huuuge, they're nowhere near as good quality-wise as SP.  Now, they're not bad, and can definitely hit the spot if SP may be a bit of a walk/stumble.  This is after having both while sober, so no everything-tastes-better-drunk influence there.

AbtkvU0__dQSKqQZcz9Q6Q.text: Great service and combos will fill you up especially if you're a fatass like me, and if you deny you are you're in denial. ;)
